Hola. Soy Miguel Rossi. Con respecto al tema de antes/despues de ICL, les comento que juego desde hace muchismos a√±os, desde torneos de club, intercolegiales, interuniversitarios , he llegado hasta jugar en primera en Rosario. Me alcanzo con esto para conseguir mis objetivos???. creo que si. Pero todo lo que jugaba era por lo que me salia en el tablero, mas alla de repasar en su momento, partidas de grandes maestros. Y mis aperturas o defensas eran muy limitadas, y no conocia nada de estructuras de peones. Desde que me invitaron a unirme a ICL, es como que estoy aprendiendo "de nuevo" a jugar ajedrez. Con conceptos, con planes, etc. Y mi ELO en liches varia entre 2000 y 2180 aprox, y no me preocupa perder o ganar ese ELO. Pero lo bueno es que estoy aprendiendo muchas cosas. Y me pregunto: "a donde hubiera podido llegar si hubiera tenido una ICL cuando era joven???". Bueno, los chicos que estan aca, aprovechen esta escuela para formarse como ajedrecistas y como personas, estudien y van a poder llegar muy lejos. Soy un "simple jugador de club", y estoy aprendiendo mucho con ICL, con Cristian a la cabeza. Estos tematicos han hecho que amplie mi repertorio. Por ejemplo, nunca estudie la defensa francesa. Ahora la uso muchisimo y con buenos resultados. La dragon, nunca la tuve en en cuenta, y ahora la estoy aprendiendo. Mi consejo es que aprovechen las clases y sigan los consejos de Cristian.

I‚Äôve had several lessons with Cami now. I should say that I am essentially a beginner as I am coming back to chess from close to a decade of not playing. First off, I‚Äôll deal with some non-chess related, general considerations:
1.	Her English is very good. We don‚Äôt speak English often but when we do her accent in particular is impressive.
2.	If her English is good, her Italian is enviable. I chose Cami as an instructor mostly so that we could have lessons in Italian. My level is around C1 (CILS exam certified) but her ability with the language far surpasses my own, which is perfect for me.
3.	She‚Äôs friendly, well prepared, and quite patient
During our lessons she focuses mostly on helping me to think accurately about a given position. In our last lesson, for example, we went over one of her games and I was struck by the simplicity of her thought process and I‚Äôve become convinced that my path forward is not going to be improving my ability to find the correct move (I usually find it, or at least the correct idea), it‚Äôs more important for me learn to separate the signal from the noise. My mind becomes to cluttered with wrong ideas that I am unable to reject. If nothing else, this ‚Äúmeta-knowledge‚Äù about my playing is worth far more than the cost of her lessons.

Jacob is the best at explaining concepts and helping you get better at chess! I could not ask for a better coach. He is very passionate and genuinely cares about his students. Although he lists an hourly rate on his coaching profile, there is no timer during lessons and there is no meticulous payout process after they end. Between the amount of time he puts in before each session (generating personalized long term goals for you, finding lines you'll like, creating personalized puzzles, etc) and the bonus sessions he does because he genuinely cares, there is hardly a question as to whether his services are worth it.  Whether you're looking to go over a game you just played or have a burning question about a new line you've discovered, Jacob is always happy to hop on a call (completely free of charge) and help out! Of course, the lessons themselves cost money, but from the minute you start your first one you will realize that you are not just Jacob's student for 2 hours every other Friday, but for the rest of your chess journey. He really takes new players under his wings and helps them grow. The 1st lesson is only $10 and I would absolutely recommend trying it at the very least to see what you think. Jacob is instructive, funny, and extremely nice (which is so important when it comes to teaching imo). You will learn so much and honestly gain a great friend and ally as you continue to climb through the rating ladder!

I'm an adult player with a peak rating in the high 1800's, and yet there are certain aspects of chess which I had practically no understanding of.

Great chess player and a fantastic chess coach. My Danish rating (almost equivalent to ELO rating) was 1397 when Covid lockdown happened. So I started having online lessons with Elshan. Since then I've played fifteen classical games in Denmark with 12 wins, 2 draws and 1 loss, having a performance rating of 2000. 
My online blitz rating on lichess also improved from 1500 to 2000. 

For someone like me who have played online chess for 10 years without reading a single chess book, not knowing anything about middle game strategies, his method did magic. He formulated all the middle game complications into few simple concepts, digestible for an intermediate chess player like me.

So if you have been also playing chess online and you feel like you are also lacking knowledge about chess, or if you feel like you have hit a chess plateau and the improvement is not proportionate to the effort, I highly recommend taking lessons with Elshan.  

Feel free to compare one of my games around March 2020 when I started working with Elshan with a recent  one. Then you'll see what I mean by "magic"
Great coach! Works on everything from systematic to calculation!

Wow!! Coach Elshan is a one of a kind coach. The way he simplifies complex ideas, and delves into the core concepts makes it possible for anyone to make significant improvements under his tutelage. I've gone from struggling against C, B players to regularly beating A, and expert players since working with him.  His passion for chess, and teaching really shines through when you interact with him. Look no further for a Coach who truly wants you to get better and will give you all the tools you need. Thanks Coach!

I started working with Elshan in January 2021 when I was around 1800 USCF, and I became a National Master in December 2022. His emphasis on the 9 imbalances has been very helpful for me. In short, Elshan is a great guy and a great coach!

Started with Elshan in October 2022 at 1750 USCF and in February 2023 have reached 2025.  +275!!! More than the rating, coaching with Elshan has helped me appreciate chess far beyond just a game but a way to learn a life lesson every day. Every day I get beaten to the dust at another tournament, Elshan has helped me prove to myself that I can keep fighting and I have kept fighting. My favorite moment was being sent a Rocky Balboa movie clip after losing yet another one, went on to win three in a row afterward!! Highly recommend him to any level!

Training with Elshan has made a significant difference in my chess, business, and overall life. As an adult improver it's not always easy to find great coaches like Elshan, but fortunately I did find him, and his instruction has been very impactful. Notably, too, I would add that many of his tactical ideas are very creative - this has come in handy for me during several games. Highly recommend.

Elshan and I met in 2014 during the 60th Maryland Open. Back then, I was 1450 USCF. Now I have just crossed the 2300 USCF barrier, as well as 2200 FIDE. Elshan is the perfect coach, mentor, and friend. If not for him, I'm not sure I would have even continued my chess journey, or if it would have been just another passion to breeze by.
As a coach, Elshan is a master (literally!) at analyzing games and coming up with specific material to optimally improve based on what he sees. As he advertises, he truly has a customized method. He can cater to any playstyle at any level.
Outside of his chess, Elshan is simply an amazing friend. He makes customized inside jokes with each of his students, which is certainly not something all coaches go through the effort of doing. He truly makes his relationship with each of his students something unique, and that is something I truly admire him for. He truly is one of a kind, and I couldn't recommend him enough.

Working with Elshan has been a genuinely life-changing experience, with benefits that extend far beyond just improving my game. His unique approach to teaching has completely changed the way I see the game and enabled me to have a greater level of sophistication and understanding of chess. For example, his emphasis on the 9 imbalances of chess truly opened my eyes to the complexities of the game and gave me a new perspective on how to approach each position strategically. Under his teaching for a little over a year, I earned the Candidate Master title, National Master title, and FIDE Master Title, and gained over 400 points. Elshan's patience and encouragement have been instrumental to my growth in the game, and he has always been available to analyze my games and provide insightful feedback. His passion for the game is contagious, and he has helped me to develop a deeper appreciation for the nuances of chess. In addition to his coaching, Elshan's book, Sherlock's Method, delves into many interesting and fascinating concepts and offers a holistic view on the game. It has been an invaluable resource for me, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to improve their game. Thanks to Elshan's coaching, I was able to achieve one of my greatest accomplishments - winning the World School Chess Championship u15 in Panama with a score of 8.5/9. This would not have been possible without his guidance and support. I highly recommend Elshan to anyone looking to take their chess game to the next level. He is an exceptional coach who is truly invested in his students' success, and I feel incredibly fortunate to have had the opportunity to work with him.

Working with Elshan has been a fantastic experience, and a major part of me "rediscovering" chess as an adult improver.  For over 10 years of hovering in the expert level I had dabbled off and on with trying to make progress on my own and crack the master title with little success.  I'd met Elshan briefly a number of years ago at a tournament and remembered him being a very pleasant and genuine person, and knew of his reputation as a coach - so when I finally decided to look for a coach he was a natural fit.  

Early in our work Elshan was able to identify a few major areas needing improvement and to help tailor our lessons accordingly. Through an ongoing process of game review, opening preparation, and covering a variety of middle and endgame positions we have been able to make significant progress in these areas.  Elshan has helped encourage me to play new opening systems and become comfortable handling a much wider range of positions.  He also did a fantastic job of connecting opening work with typical middle game ideas to help develop a better feel for these systems.  He also provided helpful homework positions or recommended games/reading to supplement our work.  Elshan brings a high level of professionalism and knowledge to his lectures, and is also very grounded and personable in his interactions.  Overall really a pleasure to work with him.  

After a long time stuck in the expert range I credit working with Elshan as a major part of breaking through to the NM title at age 35.  His guidance in focusing on areas for improvement was a key part of this, and something I had not been able to achieve by dabbling with a range of chess books on my own.  Progress does not come on a silver platter, but if you are willing to put in the work I highly recommend Elshan as a coach.

I've been training with Coach Dejan for approximately 20 weeks now, and the transformation in my strategic chess understanding has been outstanding. His teaching approach is anchored in a deep understanding of various structures and patterns, breaking them down via high-level games to illustrate complex strategies and concepts in a way that is both understandable and applicable. 

Throughout our time together, Dejan has demonstrated unwavering professionalism and patience. Despite my rescheduling of multiple lessons, he remained patient, understanding, and committed to my progress. Our coach-student relationship has been stellar, contributing to an excellent learning atmosphere.

If there's one area I would suggest for improvement, it's a slightly greater focus on improving calculation skills. However, I understand that Dejan's priority was enhancing a different aspect of my game first, and the strategic growth I've experienced under his guidance is undeniable.

I would highly recommend Coach Dejan, especially to tactical players looking to diversify their skills. With Dejan's coaching, you're not just learning the moves; you're understanding the game from a holistic perspective.

I have been taking lessons with Cherry for about 1 month.  The lessons are via Skype using screen-sharing.  During our lessons, she has divided the time between reviewing homework answers, the day's lesson content, and homework assignment.

Lesson content I expect will vary for everyone who chooses a coach due to skill level and goals.  I can say that as a relative beginner level player she is providing instruction on the fundamentals of playing the game in the opening, middle, and end game.  The homework allows one to apply the fundamentals learned during the lesson.  The review of the homework at the start of each provides a feedback loop to ensure what's being learned in the lesson is making its way onto the board.

Her lessons are interactive, conversational and instructive. You review homework, discuss your answers and why you selected a candidate move, then work on  various parts of the game. Her lessons are personalized to you, while at the same time spending time on other aspects, such as end games. It is a well rounded lesson and worth the time invested.

Overall, I highly recommend her as a coach because she will give helpful insights about the game of chess.

I am very satisfied with Alejandro Vega, my online global chess coach. 
My purpose for getting a coach, was to understand the game beyond the basics. Looking for a coach, I selected Alejandro, not because he was one of the lowest priced coaches, more because I didn‚Äôt feel that with my considerable chess inexperience, I was worth an expensive coach. 
Alejandro is worth his weight in gold, and I‚Äôm lucky he is my coach. He‚Äôs a FIDE Master chess player, speaks excellent English, and is a great communicator. Alejandro is humble, not at all invasive, and very easy to get on with. Alejandro has patience and clearly has a love of chess, and also for sharing his great love of the game to others.
My greatest satisfaction with my chess coach, apart from now, regularly beating my older brother who never lost to me when I was a kid, is that he has taught me understanding of the many varied aspects and dimensions of the game in a very enjoyable way. 
Yes, my ratings improved by hundreds since I started receiving coaching, but more importantly, Alejandro taught me the value of understanding coordination of the pieces, how to have good timing and also momentum. Movement and development are far more important to understand than just trying to increase ratings. Listening to Alejandro, and studying his lessons naturally improved my ratings.
Alejandro explained the concept of the family of 16 pieces, and how they all need to be used when establishing your positions on the board. At each jump in my progress, Alejandro has shown me something new to enable me to reach for the next level of understanding. After six months of lessons, I remain keen. 
 My greatest fear when choosing a chess coach, was that we wouldn‚Äôt get on. I‚Äôm 20+ years older than Alejandro, but his modest and patient approach would work well with players of all ages. 
I hope you choose Alejandro Gonz√°lez Vega, FIDE chess Master, a really talented chess player, and coach, and now, also my friend. Good luck.

I took a few days to write this feedback and it may seem emphatic but she clearly deserves each of these words. Rucha is more than just a good chess teacher. I have been amazed by how perspicacious she is, able to quickly understand what kind of player as well as what kind of person I am. She's very considerate and patient. Whether I'm in an ambitious phase, or a more peaceful one, she always adapts herself to my pace and mood. She has always been my first supporter and sincerely cares about my achievements, never forgetting to congratulate even my smaller successes! As a teacher, she's obviously an impressive tactical player but never forgets to suggest solid moves when tactical ones are a bit difficult to find. Studying classic games, analysing my games as well as targeting new puzzles goals have been at the core of my training until now. And that helped a lot! I've only played chess a few months in high school and have never played again for 18 years. I'm now not so far from achieving 2,000+ in correspondence games! It's difficult not to be drawn into her infinite passion and discover how beautiful chess can be as I progress and discover more of it through her eyes. Those are all the reasons why I recommend her as a teacher without a doubt that she will fit your personality and style :).
Great chess teacher, very kind and patient, with a varied arsenal of tools to work my weaknesses. Thanks to his classes I am improving my perception of chess.

One of the most overused adjectives these is days is "Excellent". I hate to use it. Rucha is an EXCELLENT coach! 

As an adult learner of Chess, I was genuinely struggling before Rucha kindly agreed to help me out. Right from the start, she has been truly engaged & focused her energy on helping me improve. She gauged my level of understanding very quickly and tailored her coaching plan to suit my needs. She knows exactly how to introduce new concepts gradually & structure the training.

Here are a few things I would like to point out:
- Her unhurried style really helps me learn new concepts & understand the theory without being intimidated by it. 
- She consciously deploys the socratic method by asking pertinent questions that challenge me to think of the best tactics / strategy instead of just 'teaching' me the moves / theory. She often observes me make the mistakes and then shows me a better way. That's what a coach is supposed to do!
- She is fastidious in her approach and is a great lateral thinker; both these qualities make her a great Chess player and she challenges my mental faculties.
- She is really approachable & builds an environment that makes it easy for me to ask any question, no matter how basic / silly it is. 
- She genuinely cares about my progress as a student & invests her time to gauge it. She takes the time to review my games and gives me feedback not just on the overall game, but on specific moves. 
- Most importantly, you can feel her passion for Chess in her voice & thought process. Another word that gets thrown around a lot is 'inspiring'. I don't take that word lightly either. I can genuinely say that Rucha's passion for Chess is infectious and inspiring!

Hand-on-heart, Rucha is an excellent coach & I would always recommend her for anyone who wants to improve their game. She is a wonderful Chess player, an incredible coach and most importantly, she is so passionate about Chess that it is almost impossible to not be inspired!

As of the first lesson with Rucha I realized that she is completly prepared and ready to teach. She organizes her material very effective. I really appreciate the attention she puts into her student. By that she is able to recognize strength and weakness in a short time.

Rucha is an accomplished coach. She is very well organized and well prepared for every session. She has a customized plan for every player. She is very patient and considerate. Overall, an outstanding teacher.

Every positive review you read is true. She is very patient with her students and willing to go into detail to explain things so you understand them very well. The key is the understanding and Rucha makes sure this is at the heart of the learning process for you. I've definitely improved since starting only fairly recently. She has a great tactical eye too and is always looking for more in the position, why does this matter? well I've found that I'm now copying this process and working with the same thought process she does is working wonders in analysing and evaluating both simple and complex positions helping me gain a real understanding of what the position demands. I've not mastered it yet, but it's only a matter of time and continued support from her that I'll get there. I Highly recommend Rucha to any player that wishes to improve from total beginner to master. Did I mention her English is great too!
Rucha is very calm and patient by nature, methodical in her teaching, focused on the learning process and determined on improving fundamental concepts. All these virtues make her a brilliant coach.

Rucha excels at identifying your weakness and giving personalized advice to help resolve them. In my case she pointed out that while I may love flashy sacrificial chess, my style lends itself to solid positional play (especially when I have lots of time on the clock). Since trying to follow this advice, not only has my rating started to trend up, the quality of my wins has improved. Previously, a lot of my wins featured me being worse/lost the whole game and tricking my opponent in time trouble. Now, I more often win by getting an edge early in the game, building a sound attack, and converting an end game. I really enjoy working with Rucha and can't recommend her coaching highly enough!

I reached out to Rucha about a year ago for my then six-year-old son, who was showing interest in chess. 

I was hoping for a teacher who themself were a student of the game, were working towards attaining their own chess norms, were mature and patient enough to not only guide a kid but also kindle his interest and lead him in his journey, and simultaneously display rare human virtues: compassion and empathy. Was I ever going to find such a teacher? Well, having experienced it firsthand, let me honestly opine something - Rucha is above and beyond what I was looking for! You ought to read about her achievements and her chess journey since her childhood. Yet, when she teaches, she keeps everything aside and her focus is on her student's improvement. She comes prepared, has a plan for every lesson, makes them fun, presentable, gives homework, expects it to be completed, and is sharp enough to reel your attention back should you deviate off-topic. The calmness, motivation, and care she shows rub off positively, and because of this, my kid wants to show his improvement in return. We are in this long term and I can certainly vouch that if you're looking to improve your game, whatever level you're at currently, Rucha is the one to mentor you, and take you leaps and bound.

I probably have every video that he has done in recent years as well as every book and I follow his posts on social media.  I am also the long time president of the Chess Federation of Canada for the last seven and a half years and the workload for this volunteer position is one reason that I had to stop subscribing for now.  If they would just nominate someone who I would be comfortable turning my baby the CFC over to, I would probably sign up again in a heartbeat. I can add to the list of recommendations for Nigel as a really excellent chess coach.

Lessons are easy to arrange, always start on time, are well-planned, and the follow up PGN files arrive right after the lesson finishes. 

During the lessons, Nigel always asks insightful questions and always seems a step ahead in knowing exactly the right questions to ask.

It took me some time to commit to the ‚ÄúTiger approach‚Äù based on solid openings, but I can now say I wish I had committed to this far earlier as I would have saved a lot of time, energy and money over the past few years. 

I now feel I have a settled and professional opening repertoire for the first time as a player (I have been playing over 30 years and am rated about 1900) and understand much better what I am doing  - and I can now turn my attention to the more important task of improving my endgame play.

Nigel is a maestro of chess instruction in addition to being a strong GM. 

He is an instructor of vast experience and ability which have made him justifiably one of the very few players in the world to hold FIDE titles of Senior Trainer and of Grandmaster.

I have taken dozens of Zoom lessons with him. Each one has been a delight and in all he has revealed the secrets of the key positional forces that lie, often hidden to us club players, beneath each chess position. 

His focus on the underlying meaning of the position, rather than overanalysing every move, has cured my tendency to get into time trouble and resulted in a related improvement in my grade. 

For depth of experience and clarity of expression he is a trainer who is one of the World's best.

This way his lessons are incredibly engaging and you can go through an incredible amount of topics in a small amount of time. After a couple of lessons I can already feel the improvements in my understanding of the game that I would've never achieved on my own. He also provides an incredible amount of homework and study material that by itself would be worth the price. You want to improve your chess? You came to the right place!

I met Andrea in a period in which I was not getting any satisfactory results, despite having a lot of didactic material available and I was working hard on the study and analysis of my games. In the end I decided to contact a qualified instructor who could finally give the right indications and identify the weaknesses of my game and my preparation. I can say that since the first lesson Andrea has shown not only to understand what exactly my difficulties were, but also to find a simple, effective and personalized remedy to help me get out of them. For example, after the first month of lessons, during a game I realized that my attention was focused on elements and maneuvers that I would never have considered before, finding a noticeable improvement in the understanding of the game; merit of the exercises aimed precisely at favorably conditioning certain thought processes. Andrea is certainly a very competent and experienced instructor, able to encourage the growth of all those who want to rely on his skills.

I have known Bal√°zs for a long time, and been preparing together since 2013. I have known Bal√°zs since my childhood, he has been my coach for 2 years now, and I wholeheartedly recommend him to all of you. Let me explain why: 
1. He's got a very deep and stable knowledge in chess. He's literally always up-to-date with all the opening nuances. Give him any position, and he'll know (or at least has a pretty good feeling about) the correct middlegame strategy, and what your opponent might try against your plan. When it comes to the endgame he's more like a machine than just a simple mortal man, because he can and will grind every bit out of the endgames. Also, if you think you can outcalculate him in a tactical battle, think again. :)
2. His character. He's always a lot of fun, time just flies by during training sessions, I guarantee that you'll never be bored or feel bad after spending an hour of chess with him. His positive and objective attitude is truly contagious.
3. His teaching style. He can explain even the most complex positions so easily that even a 9-year-old could catch the position's sense. He'll find the best opening that suits you, and will give you super broad and deep analysis about that. After this, it's really a matter of practicing and remembering. You'll simply adapt his approach to middlegames and endgames. This is the main reason why I keep being better.
In 2 years, I have gained 200 ELO points in OTB chess with his help, in spite that I barely play 20 rated games per year. I managed to surpass the dreaded 2000 ELO barrier, and I'm on my way to the FM title and beyond. :) Preparing for important matches feels like a ride in a theme park with Bal√°zs's teaching method. He was fully committed from the start, and this hasn't changed over the years.
All in all, if you want to have a visible progress, you must contact him. In my opinion, his hourly rate is a huge bargain compared to what you receive during the lectures.

Bal√°zs is an opening expert and a strong positional player. He is very close to his GM title and I'm sure he is going to achieve it soon. He is very friendly and professional, I recommend him as a coach.

I have known Bal√°zs for many years and have to admit that his talent and dedication are unique even among chess professionals. He cares about his students' progress while taking enormous effort into the materials that he teaches. His teaching skills are very well demonstrated by the results of his students. Bal√°zs is an opening expert and his chess style contains many elements of the so-called classical school. Taking everything into account I wholeheartedly recommend him as a coach.

If you are serious about improving your chess skills and seeking a coach who truly cares about your progress, I highly recommend Bal√°zs.

Here is my personal experience working with him:

- Before our first lesson, I played in a tournament and asked Bal√°zs to help me analyze my games afterwards. Despite not having met yet, he closely followed all my games and promptly answered any questions I had during the tournament breaks. This level of attentiveness was unprecedented in my previous experiences with other coaches.

- During all our lessons, Bal√°zs demonstrated a deep understanding of chess and conveyed his insights in an easily comprehensible manner. I could freely ask him any questions without feeling judged, and he was quick to point out any mistakes in my game. His unique approach made me feel like he was always on my side and working with me to improve my game.

I am a 2350 rated player who has taken lessons from many different GMs in the past, but have been working with GM Moranda exclusively for the past year. None of the past coaches have been as prepared, dedicated, and communicative as GM Moranda. He has found some extremely creative and original opening lines that are all extensively computer verified and he is more than willing to share them with his students. I think these lines alone are worth the price of his lessons. 

GM Moranda is a very practical coach who is not interested in things like memorizing tablebases or solving highly abstract chess problems. He prefers to challenge his students with interesting and highly practical studies from real games. It is clear that his goal is to raise the ELO of his students as fast as possible.

Finally, his analysis of your games is extremely informative. It is clear that he analyzes each of your games with care - for example he will highlight moves that the computer does not mark as blunders because these are impractical moves which lead you to a tough practical position even if they are not technically wrong according to the computer. I feel that his insight into my games has made me a much more rounded and thoughtful player and I am certain that he will take me to the IM level in the near future.

I am a 1500 rated player having lessons with GM Moranda for the last 18 months, who has got back into playing chess some 40 years after learning when I was a child. He is always punctual for our lessons and every lesson adds more firepower to my game.  Between lessons he is always available to answer any questions I may have and replies to my emails promptly. Lance is, in my opinion, a great chess coach for 3 major reasons. 

1) Knowledge. From Lance's chess achievements, it is clear that he understands the game of chess on both a deep level intellectually (which is needed for good teaching) and intuitively (which is needed for good play, especially at faster time controls). I believe this intuition is largely due to the second major reason: 

2) Formulaic Process. Lance does not try to teach you 'abstractly' how to play chess, he presents to you a very clear and structured way of approaching the game that, if followed, Will Work Every Time, it is simply a matter of internalizing and recognizing these steps in a game.

3) Personality. Lance genuinely loves chess, loves teaching it to others, and cares about his students' progress. This comes across in his teaching and, combined with his knowledge and process, makes for a positive and very useful learning environment.

I had a couple of long lessons with Lance over skype chat. We analyzed games and he shared an opening repertoire with me. He has a lot of knowledge about the game and types extremely fast. His advice is going to fly into your eyes before you can even blink! He is passionate about the the game and it shows.

Daniel brought my game into the spotlight.

Knowing Daniel and being his student was the best thing that happened to my progress in chess. I discovered chess at the age of 36 and I started working with Daniel when I didn't have an official rating and I hadn't played any official games over the board. Thanks to him I grew, I gained confidence and I managed to win against players from 1700-1800, in official tournaments, over the board.  Daniel's style of training is based on the rapid identification of weaknesses in a student's preparation, and the conducting of lessons in such a way as to cover these weaknesses, so the student's progress is visible from one session to another.  I recommend Daniel as a coach to all those who want to systematically learn the basic principles of the game of chess. He helped me to avoid the pitfalls of the opening, to go on solid and verified lines, to correctly identify the plans in the middle game and to be able to lead the game towards an end in which I can fight for victory. So, to cut a long story short, Danile can take you from no rating to fighting 1800 players in less than 2 years.

Daniel is a very good coach. He is a great observer and spot my week point fast so we can work on it and improve my game. The learning tehniques he uses are helpful. He is a great men and give a good vibe.

Perfect coach!

He'll help you to pick openings according to your character, temperament or/and your wishes and needs.

His lessons are exciting and valuable.
I strongly recommend him as a coach!

P.S. Can't wait to start working with you again.

Dmitry proved himself to be a responsible and highly qualified coach during his time working with my son. 
He has sufficient knowledge in the tactics and strategy of chess, has extensive gaming experience and can show the studied material by his examples.

I was a frightened beginner in chess when I turned to Dmitry, and he helped me develop my knowledge and skills so effectively that I became much more confident in the game and started winning with much stronger opponents. His deep knowledge and ability to convey it clearly made the learning process easy and enjoyable for me. I am grateful to Dmitry for understanding the needs of his students and knowing how to achieve better results. Dmytro is an excellent coach. He provides detailed analysis and instruction and does a thorough job in ensuring you understand the ideas in the position. Im Mischuk is a great Trainer with strong positional understanding and ability to explain. Very nice and polite. Since I study with him my understanding improved significantly.

I've been working with FM Smith for about a month now. I've seen a great improvement in my tactics and have went up over 100 rating points so far. I highly recommend him.

I have been playing chess for over a decade. When I reached out to FM Smith, I was very hesitant initially because I was already rated around 1900 USCF and thought I needed a GM coach, perhaps. Well, I was proven very wrong. FM Smith has been by far the best coach I have worked with so far. He has a deep, strategic understanding of the game and is able to work with his students and immediately identify their weaknesses. It took us just 2 lessons for him to spot all of my major weaknesses and he has been working with me diligently to help me overcome these weaknesses. At 1900, I thought I already knew some of the basic concepts in chess, but after working with FM Smith, I realized I had major misconceptions about chess principles. He has helped me to come up with an easy and digestible way of evaluating any chess position. As a result, when I play a game today, I have more clarity over the board and fewer candidate moves to consider (saving me countless hours on the clock!). FM Smith's coaching style is flexible and his ideas are original. He is a chess prophet!

Shrey's passion for chess makes it easy to learn and grow as a student. Shrey is friendly, knowledgeable, and a positive mentor who can simplify tactics down to the building blocks of the game. I found myself learning more than I could have ever hoped under his direction. I highly recommend learning from Shrey and hold him in the highest regard as a teacher and person!

I've been working with Shrey for just under a year now and I couldn't be happier with the results! He has helped me build a strong tactical intuition and also showed me how to apply fundamental chess principles to all aspects of my game. My rating has gone up and I recently went undefeated in a rapid tournament on lichess. But most importantly, he's showed me how to analyze my own games and learn from my mistakes. Definitely recommend reaching out to Shrey if you've hit a wall and feel like you are making the same mistakes in your games. He will help you see the game in a new way!

I‚Äôve made dramatic improvements since I started working with Shrey. He‚Äôs very demanding and pushes me to my limits, but he‚Äôs also patient and understanding and knows how to strike the right balance between fun stuff and hard work. He has a wealth of techniques and material that have really helped me. He‚Äôs pointed out weaknesses I didn‚Äôt even know I had, and he knows how to work on them. It really shows in my results ‚Äì now I regularly beat players against whom I never stood a chance just a year ago. Look, if you‚Äôre reading this text, chances are you know roughly where you‚Äôd like to go. But even the brightest students get stuck sometimes, and a coach will help you get back on track quickly. No chess coach on earth can replace you as the driver (i. e., doing all the hard work) but they can tell you where to stop and turn, saving you a lot of time on your journey. And Shrey is an outstanding coach who knows how to help you.

Pretty good teacher, patient and explains well. His 5-minute rule is very helpful to make sure you are thinking deeply and critically. It is very apparent that he cares a lot about teaching and his students; he provided many helpful materials to succeed.

Very good teacher and very nice person. His method of working is really enjoiable with the 5min rule: he force you to think even when you suppose to have the right reply in the position; in this way he forms your self-control that is a crucial skill in over the board situation, especially in long time control but also in rapid.
Infact many points we lost are not because of our poor skill, but because of our wrong decision in position where we can play a good move (best or 2nd best) and instead we play a random move.
Very kind person and very expert trainer!! Thank you coach!!
Very precise and professional.  Clear expectations for my daughter after our first lesson.

Dejan Stojanovski is very knowledgeable as expected from an IM. Lessons are very flexible with regards to schedule. He makes use of a great 5 minute rule that makes you think about positions. It is very important to focus and not just listen to his explanations. It helps to keep in mind the concepts he explains when playing games. He also offers the possibility to play a game during lesson which we then analyse together. Looking forward to more lessons!

Excellent teacher.  My 11-year-old son is doing a high level endgame course with Dejan.  He forces the student to think about each problem and explains the concepts very well.  Fluent English and easy to coordinate lessons.

I had two lessons so far with Dejan. The lessons are very well prepared and personalized. They include problems (applying the famous 5 minute rule), concepts or practice games which should be analysed as homework for review in the next lesson.
Dejan's passion for chess and teaching is obvious and he is genuinely interested in student's progress. 
Overall I am very pleased and will continue with a long term plan.
Just started to get lessons from Dejan. He is not just a great trainer but also a very nice person. He is ready very well prepared to lessons.  Waiting for next lessons now :)

Dejan makes sure that you're well stimulated and challenged. His approach is patient and focused, always encouraging you to analyze your situation as deeply and efficiently as you can. I would greatly recommend him!

Enjoyable lessons with a focus on improving your thinking about a position. Understandable both in explanations and good English, Dejan is a great and well organised teacher.

As a club player with about 26 years of serious chess experience, I was finding it difficult to improve. Affordable long term coaching in the UK for my level (unless you're a junior) is difficult to come by, especially outside of the London area. I'm very pleased with the lessons I'm receiving via skype and only wish I'd taken some sooner. Looking forward to enjoying my chess games even more.

My son had 2 lessons with Dejan. He is very enthusiastic about chess and follow a structured approach.

Great personality, excellent explanations and clearly conveys important strategical aspects and plans.  The 5 minute rule where the student analyzes critical positions is quite the mental workout and really pushes my limits.

Very excited to continue working with IM Stojanovski!
I just started, but the lessons are a lot of fun. Dejan is very motivated and gives great insight. There's no better coach for this kind of money!
Very friendly, very helpful, lots of energy! The problems he presents you with are a great way to force you to deeply analyze a position. Looking forward to working more with him!
Just started with Dejan and I am very happy. He clearly has a lot of experience and motivates me to improve. Looking forward to the rating gains :)
Dejan is a very experienced coach who always comes well prepared for lessons. I've only taken a couple of lessons so far, but already am feeling improving. I'd highly recommend him as a coach.
Just started with Dejan as well! I'm impressed by the way he immediately guessed my character by my games only :) Will definitely use his 5-minute rule in the next OTB games!

Dejan has recently started coaching a student of mine and even though it's early in the programme, I think we can expect great results.

Dejan is a fantastic guy and a really enthusiastic chess coach.  He was able to identify problem areas from a few sample games and build a structured lesson plan around them.  

He has also been very understanding/flexible in finding a time to suit our busy schedule!

Cheers Dejan!

A great first lesson with Dejan. I enjoyed his suggested approach of applying the five minute rule, encouraging deeper thought on the rationale for your move choices and ideas. Looking forward to the next few lessons.

I've been working with Dejan for nearly 4 months now. And he has improved my skill a lot. In 4 months, my rating has increased by 200. Dejan teaches many different rules and concepts to students and then he will test their skill in a game. 
His teaching is very structured and I can definitely recommend him as a coach. :)

I recently finished the chesscamp in Skopje with Dejan. It was a really nice experience. 
The lessons were really strong and I'm sure that with his help I will improve a lot and finally reach my goals. 
His training methods are well structured. I learnd a lot about the Endgame rules, different ideas in the Middlegame and really strong Oppening Lines. 
For sure I will definitely continue with Skype lessons.
I'd highly recommend him as a coach. He¬¥'s also helpful and a really great person. Thank you so much Dejan and wish you all the best.

Very affordable coaching. The prices for USD are $200 for 10 lessons or $300 for 20 lessons. Although you have to buy in bulk, each lesson is an hour long for only $15 - $20. 

The lessons themselves are focused on challenging you to think deeply.

Near the last dozen minutes of end of the lesson you will get to play a game with him, regardless if the game end time exceeds the lesson limit or not. For example, my first lesson the game finished around 15 minutes over the lesson time.

For $300, you will have up to 20 weeks of a professional high rated coach. That's over a third of the year. I've seen other coaches ask for $50-$100 an hour, which isn't affordable to many of us. I really think this coach is a steal.

IM Dejan is an awesome coach as he is a very enthusiastic chess player, with me he starts practicing out of the opening and we stop at critical moments in the position, then I have 5 minutes to think. This is an excellent approach, as I learn a bit of the opening and then the correct plans to apply in such positions. If you have a 2 hours' lesson, he offers to play a 30 mins game with you which is perfect.
And not to forget, his lessons are very affordable, I would say one of the best value for money packages I have ever seen.
A chess coach to recommend!

I have completed 7 lessons with Dejan so far. He is an experienced chess coach, his lessons are interactive and suited to the student's level. From my point of view, the main advantage of working with him is that he points out what my weaknesses are (it's not so easy to realize it on my own) and he provides excellently selected books for training (with so many information out there, for an 1670 ELO rated amateur like myself it's hard to choose what to study).
I am pretty confident that I will get to the next level with him as my coach.

Just had the first lesson with Dejan and the tl;dr is "I wish I did this months ago".

Dejan prepared a few positions for me and they were all challenging enough I had to work hard to solve them, but not so hard I felt frustrated. 

He explained me why positional play is important in a way that I will never forget. He is also very enthusiastic as a player and a teacher. You feel he wants you to get better and that's a great source of support.

Highly recommended!
Very good coach. The interactive lesson is really suit for me. Dejan shows a game and ask few questions that help me understand better. And the price is reasonable.
Dejan has a good approach to teaching. He is patient and seems to have a good system. I have only taken a few lessons with him so far, but I'm looking forward to the next!

I have just started my chess lessons with Dejan!! I am very very happy of having booked chess lessons with him ^^ He has a very nice approach and although I am still in the beginning I feel that I will improve a lot with his coaching :)!! He is also a very nice guy, I would definitely recommend him if you are searching for a chess coach ;)

Dejan is an awesome teacher and a brilliant chess player. I have done two classes with him so far but I already feel like my comprehension of the game has improved a lot: before I would play almost random moves which I thought looked good; now my game is more focused and I know what are the good plans in some positions. Dejan's method is simple and effective: he will analyze with you some critical positions for half of the lesson, while in the other half he will play a game with you, which will be analyzed in the following lesson, so you can actually learn from your mistakes. It is just incredible that his hourly rate is so affordable for such high quality lessons! I warmly recommend working with Dejan to chess players of all levels!
Dejan is an excellent teacher and a fantastic guy. I've just started the classes with him and I am very happy. I recommend him as a coach if you want improved quickly your level.
Dejan is a good teacher and conducts himself very professionally. I took 50 lessons with him and I recommend him unreservedly.

Dejan has a method: 5 minutes rule means he let you think for that time to solve a problem after a few comments on the possition. You analyze and decide, then he unfolds the solution. He explains clearly and to the point. I find this training system to be useful.

I hope to increase my understanding of chess with him.

my son Ryan has only been practicing lecturing with Dejan for two months,but from beginning it was clear how precise and proffesional the chess lectures are.Ryan is looking forward to each next training.

Just finished the first of a series of lessons with Dejan. First impression is that he is friendly, well prepared and flexible with scheduling the lessons. Also I really like the way the lessons are structured, with the main segment consisting of going over positions with ample time for the student to analyze before discussing each position. The last segment is a game vs the coach, of which analysis will be part of next lesson. Entertaining and educational lessons!

Dejan is a brilliant coach, I heavily recommend him. His lessons are well structured and carefully planned, and excellent value for money. It is really good how his lessons are interactive with the '5 minute rule'. This means it is very intense with lots of thinking, and learning by doing, not just a lecture. 5 stars!

I've finished my first lesson with Dejan. He is very professional, and brought an interesting game to analyze in order to explain interesting concepts, from abstract strategies and some resulting tactics that appeared in the game. He proposed a long term play, which I accepted and I expect to learn a lot from him the following year (or years?).

I would highly recommend Dejan as a chess coach for inspiring players. He requires his students to be involved in the learning process by evoking a '5 minute rule'. These 5 minutes are a wonderful insight into critical middle game structures. The student first deconstructs the position, and then Dejan covers what they may have missed. This gives the student plenty of material to review and build off of for their own games. Tactical and strategic motifs are highlighted in every session as the 'ah ha' moments inspire the student to keep pressing forward. Glad to have as a coach!
bravo

So far I have completed four sessions with Dejan. At this point I can say that I am very happy with the structure of each lesson, as well as the study plan. My weakness is the middle game and we focus mostly on this while also bringing in some endgame and opening ideas. 
I enjoy Dejan's structured way of working in and outside of the lessons. I greatly appreciate his punctuality and you can clearly tell he takes his job seriously.

Today was my fourth lesson with Dejan. So far, I have a very positive impression ‚Äî positive enough to commit to long-term coaching. His approach is very systematic. You know exactly what to expect. And he doesn't mess around. He wants you to get better and will give you all of the tools you need to do so. 

At the moment, we're working on my basic strategic understanding. So, in each session so far, we've worked through games that illustrate a particular principle ‚Äî for example, how to play in opposite-side castling situations. During such sessions, he gives you a chance to think through key positions in the game. Then he gives you feedback on your thinking and explains what, if anything, you missed. This kind of active engagement with constant feedback/correction seems like a great recipe for improvement. I'm very excited about his coaching program and looking forward to getting stronger and developing my understanding of the game.

Finally, you can tell that Dejan really cares about his students. He's a very supportive coach who wants to help you to improve your chess *and* how you relate generally to playing, winning, and losing. And, of course, you can tell that he loves chess and he wants share that love. As a result, sessions are both challenging and a lot of fun!

I have had 6 lessons with Dejan and have been very happy so far. It's clear that a lot of thought and planning has gone into the curriculum. The themes he presents are designed to address what is uncovered in the training games that accompany each lesson. Excited to continue working with him.

As a math teacher myself, I can say that Dejan is a natural educator.  He identifies growth areas, puts the student in the position to think critically, and then summarizes the findings nicely.  He is encouraging, but also honest and no-nonsense.  He is an excellent coach all-around.  I've had 20 lessons with him so far.

I am a 41 year old just shy of 2k USCF player, who has been looking to really go deeper.  I have really enjoyed my work with Dejan quite a bit.  His 5 minute rule definitely helps encourage the right thinking process, and he seems to have a deep understanding of what it takes to improve.  
I have many chess books, and I find there is nothing better than 1 on 1 interaction discussing what is best, and what to do.  Sure, a computer can spit out the best move eventually, but a human will teach you to play human chess, and sad as it may be, I am only human!

I am a native English speaker, and I note at times there are rather minor issues with his vocabulary.  There aren't many times I've noticed it, and if it weren't for recording the lesson and replaying it I wouldn't always catch everything he says due to him speaking so fast at times, but I don't dock him for this.  I would be remiss to not mention it in a review.  I am sure if I asked, he would speak more slowly!

Overall, however, I was eager to reup for another large set of lessons as I feel he has a real purpose to the types of questions he asks, and I love his no nonsense approach.

I would recommend him without reservation.

I have had ten lessons with Coach Dejan so far, and he is an excellent teacher. He is enthusiastic, friendly, and extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of chess. I started 10 lessons with Dejan, and quickly agreed to a longer package.  I‚Äôve now completed 26 lessons as part of a 100-lesson package over the last 10 months.  They have become a highlight of my week.  

As other reviewers have said, Dejan uses a 5-minute rule, where he instructs students to determine the best plan or move in a critical position in a master level game.  I‚Äôve found this to be extremely helpful in developing my thought process and positional understanding in chess.  The last 15 minutes of the lesson are a practice game in rapid format.  Dejan has students review this game themselves (no computer), send the annotations back to him, and then reviews them together every 3-4 lessons.  I can point to multiple OTB games where I‚Äôve directly used the concepts and motifs learned from the lessons and practice games.  As an example, I‚Äôve found that I‚Äôm much more effective at taking advantage of my opponents‚Äô slow/inaccurate play in the opening/early middle game, simply because I‚Äôve seen how Dejan does it so effectively to me in practice games üòä.  

In terms of results, I‚Äôve gone from just under 1800 to 2100 on lichess rapid.  I‚Äôve also improved from the low 1600s to the low 1700s USCF.  This is from only 4 OTB tournaments (15 games), so I believe I have more to go.  More importantly, I‚Äôve begun to develop a positional understanding of chess which has begun to show in my games.  Being able to see and understand these subtleties has enhanced my appreciation, enthusiasm, and enjoyment of the game.  All in all, I‚Äôd highly recommend lessons with Dejan!

Not only does this demonstrate a depth of knowledge and wealth of diverse lesson plans, but a fundamental patience and personable approach to teaching that all great instructors of any discipline possess.  Add these virtues to an ability and willingness to be flexible on time and you have unquestionable value.  I do not hesitate to recommend Nick to anyone thinking of honing their skills in this intriguing game.

Player

If a chess player really wants to improve it is important that he has a guide; the good instructor, in fact, sets the pace of study, understands in which areas it is appropriate to work more and knows how to motivate the student. Luis has been working with me for about a month now.  I had been working with another coach, but as online coaching can be expensive, I wanted to find someone who could do additional lessons.  Luis only charges $10 for a 1-hour class, which is an absolute bargain.

We spend most of our lessons going over grandmaster games that have similar opening lines that I use - He shows me the games, and explains each move, and at critical moments he'll ask me to analyze a particular line or find a move.  This has helped me understand not just my openings, but also tons of middlegames and plans that top grandmasters employ. 

He's been extremely helpful in explaining what goes into making good moves and how to think like a grandmaster.  He has a clear and organized method of teaching that's easy to follow and will quickly help you find better moves on the chess board. 

In addition to the excellent content, he's hilarious and fun to work with.  He's an incredibly strong player - ~2400 (Could probably be a GM given how young he is still), but he's never condescending or rude.  He's very fast to respond to questions outside of the lesson, sends me lots of positions and homework material, and offers participation of simuls and other practice games.  

I've worked with lots of coaches and all of them have had something to offer - But Luis is absolutely excellent!

I've had lessons with a number of different teachers over the years and Vladan is one of the best. Whilst every one of them has been a strong player, he is one of the few who clearly cares about my playing and progress, and has made a real effort to identify my weaknesses and tailor a programme to address them. Most teachers I've used have given stock lessons from books on endgames, tactics or openings, but have never looked at a single game I've played or given any constructive criticism on my weaknesses beyond "improve your tactical play" or "study this opening more". Vladan's lessons cover not only the usual chess theory that you'd expect, but he also asks you to send him examples of longer time control (15 0+) games you've played each week, and then spends considerable time reviewing them with you. It can be a bit painful having someone else focus in so clearly on mistakes you've made, but if you genuinely want to improve then it's something you're probably going to have to do. Further to this, Vladan's English is very good, he's patient and a good communicator, explaining very clearly why moves were poor or what you should be looking at in any given position. It's not hard to see why he's one of the most highly rated teachers on the ICC.

On top of all this, he's a really nice guy.

Vladan provides a highly methodical approach to studying openings, something I did not have before our sessions. Vladan can break down an opening into finite chapters, making the road to improvement appear suddenly from the chaos of our modern day database trees.

Vladan is an excellent coach and has helped me with opening, middle game, and ending theory.  Vladan has a well organized lesson structure and emphasizes the aspects of the game that are necessary to the player's individual level, and also helped me learn how to efficiently study chess, like how much time you should spend a week on certain areas of the game.  He finds tactical problems that are appropriate to your level, and shows important examples of endgame theory.  He also finds games that highlight an opening you are working on, and does a great job analyzing your own games. I also liked that he tells you what you should work on before each lesson.  He speaks fluent and concise English. Overall felt he cares and puts a lot of work for the students and I highly recommend him.

Are you a regular tournament goer? Do you have big aspirations in chess? Perhaps ever you dreamt of achieving a GM or IM norm and you often fumble along this path? Or You want to increase the fide rating and want to win tournaments but you easily falter along the way? If your answer is yes to my above questions then you need class from a practical player.. Who often visits tournaments and had already travelled along the path that you want to travel now. Yes your guess is right.. I am asking that how about taking class from GM himself ? Practical choice right? Yes..For those who want to achieve these things Grand Master Debashish will guide along the path..
Here are the important features of his teaching style..
1) What you can expect from a regular player? Insights about tournaments? About how to prepare? How to calculate? How to play in winning situation? How to play in a losing situation? This is what he regularly does in class.. Emphasis is greatly on practical chess
2) Who isn't exited to play against a GM? I think everybody does.. Yes he plays along with students in tournaments and motivate them..
3) Perhaps how about learning from his own story? Yes he tells about how he started chess, which were important points of his career.. Those matches, tournaments and Who trained him at different stages.. Just everything..

I got to know about Debashis sir‚Äôs group classes through his Facebook post. He mentioned that he will be covering not only calculation, but also positional topics like- prophylaxis, space advantage, different types of weaknesses, etc. He also shares psychological experiences to learn from. He shows his own games once a week. Every Friday is a playing day where he creates a tournament and gives prizes. The best part of the tournament is that he himself also participates. The advantage of it is that the club level players like me get an opportunity to play against a Grandmaster. Recently he decided to keep position playing day, where he gives a certain position to play which I feel is quite interesting and useful at the same time. He is not only hardworking, sincere and passionate about chess, but is also very patient while addressing student‚Äôs doubts. 
   When I joined his group class in the first week of February, the Tata steel tournament had just got over. The biggest news for us Indians was Arjun Erigaisi finishing at dominating 1st place in the challengers section and qualifying for the next year‚Äôs masters category. Every Indian chess lover was sharing this news on different social platforms (I was one of them), but how many of us bothered to go through Arjun‚Äôs Tata steel tournament games? Very few, I guess. Debashis sir made sure that he analyzed Arjun‚Äôs each and every game deeply and break it down, so that players like us understood the behind-the-scenes action. I was amazed to see that there was so much to learn from those games. 
   I feel very fortunate to be a part of his group class and would highly recommend to all those who are serious about chess. It‚Äôs a win win situation guys!!

I can say he is a dedicated chess coach who is really aiming at spreading knowledge to his students(He is currently taking 30 group classes per month!!!)

Good training model giving importance to practical play. Most of us dream to be a grandmaster but some of us cant even afford to take coaching from Grandmaster. Short version: 
I would highly recommend Bojan to anyone looking to improve their understanding and fundamentals of chess in a structured and informative way.

Long version:
For people who want to get a better idea of how Bojan teaches and why I think it is great, I'll go over a few topics and my experiences with them

Lesson Content/Instructional Quality:
  The lessons themselves as well as the accompanying self-study content is extremely well organised, thought out, and introduces new ideas as well as building upon them in an intuitive way. Additionally, many examples are from very common positions and I've found them very helpful in learning how to apply the ideas in my own games. The lessons have a good balance of lecturing and student interaction to make sure key ideas are understood. I also feel like Bojan does a good job of covering sub-optimal moves opponents could make and how to exploit them, I find myself almost never needing to ask "what if opponent played x" style of questions.

Self Study:
  I am never finding myself in a position where I want to practice/improve at chess on my own time and do not have anything useful to do. Bojan provides a weekly exercise set based on the main idea of the lesson which is very useful for exploring and reinforcing the ideas learned. Additionally, he provides excellent daily tactical training (similar to lichess puzzles but hand-picked to explore a topic in depth, such as pins, double attacks, removing the defender, etc. ) and to your difficulty level.

Personalization:
  The biggest improvement of learning chess with a coach rather than indepedently is having lessons, exercises, and a longer term plan/curriculum tailored to you personally, which Bojan excels in. He's flexible on scheduling, goes at your pace: matches your quantity and difficulty of daily exercises to how you want to study and play the game, and takes into account topics you want to learn about for planning future lessons.

All of this has been very helpful, and has paid off in the form of a higher rating, and also having more fun while playing.

Dmitry Gordievsky is a very unique chess coach and is unlike any other. As well as being a very friendly person, he is an amazing chess coach. He teaches you things you cannot do by yourself. He‚Äôll go through things you have probably never even thought of. He pays attention to every student and personalizes the lesson for them. He‚Äôll look through your games and know exactly what you need to work on. He is very organised and will always be prepared for the lesson with a topic he wants to talk about. He aims everything at a perfect level for his students and you are constantly challenged by what he teaches you. He has been in multiple countries and therefore has a unique perspective when it comes to chess and his unique method of teaching benefits from this.


His lessons usually work like this: You will join a meeting on zoom (or possibly another app). He will talk about your most recent games and will go through anything that he thinks needs improvement. He will then ask if you have any questions about any of your games or something else. After that he will have a specific topic he talks about and will have things prepared for you to work on and talk about with him. He waits patiently while you solve those things and then goes through them with you. Then when the lesson is almost done, he will ask you if you have any questions about what you learnt today. 


So, if you want a coach who pays attention to each student, is organised, will give you great results (I myself have improved by 300 points and I have only had 5 lessons with him), is a very smart person, tells you things you wouldn‚Äôt have even thought of and is just a friendly guy, pick Dmitry Gordievsky. You will not regret it

Dmitry is a very capable chess player and a great coach. He often introduces topics that are novel to me, and that I would never otherwise have learned were it not for him. If you are considering working with a coach, I would highly recommend GM Dmitry who has a rare combination of being a great teacher along with being a strong grandmaster.

I‚Äôve spent countless hours on tactics ‚Äì done many tens of thousands. So, I was worried that a coach could easily ‚Äúmisdiagnose‚Äù my problems and would have me heading in the wrong direction. After a couple of months with coach Alex, I‚Äôm very pleased. He has been very good at identifying my problems and correcting them. He‚Äôs very responsive ‚Äì always willing to answer questions ‚Äì even between lessons. He focuses the lessons on my specific needs. He is very dedicated, and puts in many hours without compensation. He has helped me identify my weaknesses in my game of which there are many but he is dedicated to helping me, Alex I feel has given me a better understanding of the game in general. Worthy of note is that he is approachable for questions, nothing is too much trouble for him so he is willing to help and guide as necessary. He is flexible so he will tailor a plan around you and your available time; Alex is trustworthy, honest and importantly dedicated so I would have absolutely no issue with recommending him as a coach.

For many years I knew how to "play" chess but that was really just me memorizing a certain amount of moves. I would make 5 or 6 blunders per game, dozens of mistakes in longer matches. Once I found lichess I also found myself with an 800 elo rating. I decided to get a coach, and Alex is easily one of the best and most passionate teachers I've ever had. Alex will design a lesson plan for you using his vast library of chess books and his own education material; no matter how good you are at chess, Alex will make you better. Alex is teaching me not to memorize the Ruy Lopez, for example, and its variations, to 10 moves ahead, but instead showing me how to REACT to my opponents' moves and mistakes. In seven weeks I've climbed from 800 to 1337 elo and I've no plan to stop improving; Alex is the biggest part of that, and has opened my mind to a completely different way of thinking about chess!

Alex is an excellent and thoughtful coach. His curriculum gives our lessons structure, but he is not afraid to diverge from that structure to explore the nuances of different positions. Christof has an exceptional knowledge about chess combined with the ability to explain that to his students. Often during training sessions I have the impression he understands my thoughts before I do and is then able to guide me in the right direction and give the right hints. And we always find time to do some smalltalk which loosens up the training a little and - at least for me - makes the training overall more enjoyable.

On his youtube channel, Christof offers some of the best free chess content on the entire internet, but he is even better as a chess coach. I like his very personalised approach to teaching: He identifies your weak spots and compiles an individually suited study plan to address them. I think this method is the key to improvement at chess. I teach children myself and Christof helped me improve not only as a player, but also as a coach.

About a year ago i started to think about how i could increase my strength a bit better (At this point I was at ELO: 2076).
I analyzed my games, looked for some openings, solved puzzles and ... gained no progress.
So I had the feeling that I was sacrificing my time without structure and Utility.
Because I never had worked together with a coach I was not sure, for which skills I was searching for.
I knew and liked Christof`s Youtube Channel for a while, so it made sense for me to start my first experience with Christof as a coach.
Even when I hoped to get just some Key-Information It was even more surprising for me, how fast he could sort and define my concrete weaknesses. 
After analyzing my own games with some programs and commenting my thoughts during the game, he often sees Ideas which I totally missed.
I got individual homework (which was requested) for my needs. So it was just a matter of time, until my level increased (ELO: 2171).
Last but not least: He is a great guy

Passionate, lots of experience with teaching, sharp and great positional play, lots of knowledge with the opening, flawless English and very flexible with your schedules, full of anecdotes and stories. This is no surprise that  he is working for all majors chess related sites.

I have been taking lessons from Christof about a year now and can only say good things about his teaching style and the effect its had on my own progress. Before lessons I was a 1960 USCF and after only a year I've achieved 2080. He focuses on all aspects of the game and discovers your specific weaknesses. Totally worth the price if you seriously want to improve your game.

Christof is a great coach. He really gets to understand what part of your game needs improvement and helps you develop it. He gives good homework for extra studying outside of lessons as well and really shows deep knowledge of the history and theory of the game. Plus, he's just a great guy!

Christof is an excellent teacher! He takes the time to look through your games and figure out your weaknesses. During his lessons, he focused on improving my weaknesses. Christof really helped improve my thought process when it comes to tactics. After training with him, I have been able to look for the right moves and calculate more efficiently than I ever have before. He has a wide knowledge of openings and has always given me good recommendations during opening preparation. Since my training began, I've taken down numerous experts and masters in rated tournaments.

After every lesson I have had with Cristof has concluded, I always have at least two or three insightful and straight forward tips to work into my game. But most importantly for me (a humble and entirely casual player), the lessons are always a most enjoyable hour. Christof is a patient and extremely knowledgeable teacher. He provides a wealth of practical advice and is a true pleasure to deal with. I cannot recommend Christof more highly as a chess coach.

Excellent teacher that will help you improve and understand all aspects of the game. I am a 1800-1900 USCF player who takes weekly 2 hour lessons. Some lessons are focused on a single area of the game, such as specific endgame positions or positional themes. Others are focused on whole instructive games where I'm challenged to find the best moves from the first move to the last. Most importantly, however, Christof is a great communicator, which is a very rare skill among otherwise very skilled chess teachers. For the ambitious student his lessons are extremely valuable for the way he clearly conveys the way a strong chess player thinks. You can become a better player just by listening him talk about a position. If you need any examples of this you might want to check out his Youtube channel. I heartily recommend him as your long term guide for your quest for chess improvement.

Mauricio is simply the best. I've been taking lessons with Mauricio for 6 months I've gone from being rated 1550 on lichess to around 1950 consistently. Mauricio is affordable, easy to work with, has a love for teaching, and is simply an experienced and professional coach. 

Now, you may be thinking that for 20 dollars, you are going to get a coach who sits down with you for an hour once or twice a week to give you tips. You're mistaken. Mauricio provides the entire coaching experience; he makes instructive videos for you; he gets to know your playing style; he will work with and get you to your goals. He wants to see you succeed. Mauricio is the kind of person who would be a chess coach for free if it was sustainable; that is the level of commitment he has to his students.

If you are unsure about getting a chess coach, don't be. Send Mauricio a message. He will deepen your love for chess, share inspirational stories, provide advice that extends far outside of chess, and work hard for you. He will see you as a person, not as just a student. 

Simply put, I've experimented with several chess coaches before messaging Mauricio. Some were far more expensive, but none came close to the expertise, commitment, dedication and have improved my chess as much as Mauricio has.

I normally do not give reviews this early, since I like to test out the qualities of the trainer overtime, however, IM Mauricio Arias simply went above and beyond on everything you could ask for within the very first week. I chose Mr. Arias to be my coach for my goal of achieving NM strength in the USCF. I started by picking a few games I played that exemplified my playing style, and he immediately noticed my shortcomings. Upon this, he developed a plan of improvement that is focused on technique and endgame play. He made folders for me, organized the information, and assigned my readings and exercises to perform in my road of improvement. Within this week, he was also accessible anytime I happened to have a question and he was easily reachable over the phone. I shared games I played, and various positions to get his input of what his thoughts were. He was always there to answer my questions. Further, I started playing the opening he advised me to start playing and shared those games with him. When I felt down about how I played them, he immediately raised my spirits back up. In this way, he always encouraged me. The experience so far is incredible. And this is because coach IM Arias cares deeply about his students and their improvement. He is also not afraid to tell you when you have a weakness, and that you need to improve it. Lastly, he not only knows chess, but he played some of the best players in the world, and with a career of chess that spans over 20 years, he has lots of built-up knowledge and insight that will bring your game to the next level. I cannot wait to reach my goal with the help of coach IM Arias and I can confidently say that this is the best decision I've ever made in terms of my chess improvement.

Mauricio is an excellent chess coach.

He tailors lessons to my needs as a player and my interests as a learner.  Perhaps even more importantly, he has helped me with chess psychology and approach, combating bad mental habits around tilt and confidence.

Midas clearly has a great passion for chess which he puts forward and tries to mirror in his students. He is very active and energetic whilst also being very patient by allowing his students time to find answers and only giving them help if they are really stuck, thus allowing the students to find similar tactics in their games. 

Finally, Midas is as eager to help his students excel in lessons as he is outside of them. He will send you as much homework as you have time for, and is always happy to receive some of your games to further analyse. 

Midas is really an awesome teacher and I look forward to smashing the 2000 elo barrier and getting my CM title with him. If you are looking to up your game with an outstanding chess coach, don‚Äôt look any further than Midas. If I get into the universities I‚Äôm applying to, it will be greatly thanks to him which kind of means that my early career successes will be indebted to him.
