He creates a lot of bonus content as well that supplements and strengthen his in person teachings.   He's flexible and is excellent in small group environments, giving each student personal attention.  I look forward to his weekly videos and puzzles that he provides.   If you are looking for instruction, I would encourage you to consider him as your teacher.

Midas‚Äô chess credentials speak for themselves, but apart from a skilled chess player he‚Äôs also an outstanding teacher. I‚Äôve been taking private (online) lessons from Midas over the course of this year and have been thoroughly enjoying the experience, while also making steady progress. The lessons are fun and engaging. We practice with exercises, studies and puzzles and we meticulously analyze my own games; which is most insightful, if you truly want to learn from your mistakes.

Midas is very patient and is able to make the sometimes complex and intimidating concepts within chess understandable for everyone. He very quickly had a grasp on where I was at with my chess and applied a structured method to help me improve quickly and efficiently. For this reason I recommend him to both more advanced players as well as beginner players.

Apart from the lessons, Midas also equips you with some tools to study chess by yourself, with Chessable courses and video courses (he regularly makes instructional videos for his students on all kinds of chess related subjects). If you‚Äôre lucky, he might even highlight one of your games in his video!

If you're looking to improve, and possibly intimidated by seeking out a coach, then Midas is the right coach for you.  He's a natural teacher--patient, warm, and knowledgeable.  He provides you with so many resources to expand your skills as a player. 

Honestly, the only downside I've experienced with Midas as my teacher is that he helped me improve my chess so much that my friends don't want to play with me anymore.

I recently booked a small cycle of 10 lessons with Midas. Midas was my first chess teacher (I started playing Chess during Covid), and was very patient and friendly. 

our lessons normally consisted of a segment of puzzles and a segment of game analysis. Midas could provide me with as much material as I liked. 

What was really usefull was that I was learning Midas' Chessable Course at the same time, so the games we analyzed often matched his opening suggestions from that course.

During our lessons Midas often forced me to calculate just a bit further then I would do by myself. What I really liked about that is that he wouldn't just tell me why a specific move was good or bad, but he made me realize it myself. Whenever I really couldn't figure it out, he could explain clearly and understandably why a certain move or idea was good or bad.

All in all I would really recommend Midas to anyone seeking a skillful, patient teacher.

I had 10 lessons with Midas and can strongly recommend his coaching. His guidance and patience during my game analysis was really great. I feel I have a better understanding of my games and that it helped me to improve my chess. Will definitely book another 10 lessons this year. Beside this also have a look at his course on Chessable for black.

I can't recommend Yuriy highly enough! He's a great coach who has worked with me on many parts of the game. He is exceptionally good at tailoring things to my level, which was one of my main concerns about hiring a coach. I look forward to every lesson! The books he provides are also great.

Yuriy is an awesome teacher! Yuriy is a very kind and thorough teacher. Although I have known "how to play chess" (i.e., move the pieces) for many years, Yuriy was able to open my mind to a whole new perspective on chess and help me identify the knowledge and theory that I have lacked for so long. Also, Yuriy forces me to account for my moves and ensure that I understand my play and strategies. He also provides very thorough analyses of your recent games, and it becomes very evident why he is a trusted second by several GMs.

Furthermore, as a coach, Yuriy works to develop you into the player, YOU want to be. No pressure to learn certain openings or lines. He works with you to improve your game in your way.

Finally, and maybe most importantly for the amateur adult improver like myself, every session with Yuriy is fun! His enjoyment of the game is infectious - "isn't that a beautiful tactic!?", "really impressive, no!?" - and you cannot help but leave each lesson full of anticipation to play again.

Whether he likes it or not, Yuriy will definitely be seeing more of me.

I have been taking lessons with Roberto for about a month and a half. What I am most enjoying about my lessons with Roberto is that he has a very structured and clear development plan for his students that range from opening theory, calculation, endgames, tactics, psychology and the history of chess. 

Outside of the lessons you also gain access to several whatsapp groups where opening ideas, tactics, daily puzzles and endgames are discussed. We also play in team tournaments to practice the ideas learned during the lessons. 

On top of that, Roberto personally reviews matches you have played and different from an engine that just tells you the "best" move, will actually help you understand the game positions that were reached. 

He is also a chill guy, good to talk to and always brings a positive attitude. Would recommend 100%.

Roberto has great coaching methods. He iteratively covers topics such as end-games, mid-game positions, openings, calculation techniques among others. He really cares about your improvement and wants to make you think for yourself. He wants you to actually *know* what you are doing. The content he provides is great and your chess will certainly improve.

Roberto is a great coach. 
He has a very clear method for teaching. 
I started with Roberto as a complete beginner. 
He patiently brought me through basic strategies informed by the history of chess and we leaning mating patterns, key tactics and endgame ideas. 
We studied famous games and he also reviewed my own games on lichess to identify thematic flaws and areas for improvement. 
I have steadily improved over about a year from less than 1000 rating to somewhere around 1500 and have beaten a few players in the 1600-1800 range in classical or correspondence matches. .My puzzle rating has gone from around 1400 to a solid 2000. (We did lots and lots of puzzles which I have found extremely useful and relevant to game play). He also uses all the online tools that are available and affordable. 
 I still have so much to learn but it has been a great experience so far!
His advice is very practical. For example we have picked just a few openings and are studying them very deeply rathe than trying to learn 100 different openings and being mediocre at all of them. Also his ideas on mid game are very simple and elegant and provide a useful framework for decision making. He also has some very creative opening strategies that seem to work well against most intermediate players.  At worst you will be in a neutral position but often you can gain material or tactical advantage early on. 
Roberto is also extremely reliable, always on time and always prepared and fully engaged in the lesson. 
I 100% recommend Roberto for anyone from a complete beginner all the way up to  well over 2000.

Roberto is a awesome coach and person. You can notice that he cares a lot about his students. I have been his student and part of ICA community for about 6 months and I can say that, if you are serious about learning chess, he's the right guy.

He also engages with his students during the week with puzzles, studies and example games.  So much to get out of, studying with Roberto!

He improved my chess understanding and maybe even more importantly, he has reinvigorated my love for the game with his structured approach to teaching.  I highly recommend!

I have been studying with Alexis Cabrera for several years now. My son, now 14, has also been for three years in training courses for children imparted by Alexis. 

I am a teacher myself, and thus well placed to value the originality of Alexis methodology, his deep understanding of chess, and his unique way of approaching the game, which departs from the "recipe" approach, often found with other teachers, and insists in a combination of rigor, intuition and clarity of ideas. 

Alexis is also an extraordinary teacher for children, downed with infinite patience, and capable to be stern and friendly at the same time. He can handle a class of 8-10 years olds with the same easy that he can hypnotise a group of seasoned club players.

Alexis is not only interested in the game, but also in the structure of the game. We have shared many a pleasant discussions connecting chess with mathematics, artificial intelligence and even physics! 

Last, but not least, Alexis Cabrera is really, really, nice person. He combines patience (often needed with some of us, with thicker reflexes that we would like), sense of humor and sharpness that keeps you happy but on the edge. Studying chess with him has been one of the most pleasant activities of the last few years.

If you take lessons with Alexis you will notice one thing right away: above all, Alexis respects you and your chess moves, no matter how wrong you are. That says a lot about the kind of person he is, how much he enjoys teaching and how enjoyable it is to learn from him. I've seen Alexis teaching all kind of players, from beginners to IMs; he knows how to steer the narrative to make everything clear and logical. It's not just about the moves, Alexis makes you see the need for a solid foundation in order to put yourself in a position in which you'll be able to unleash your creativity over the board.

I've been working with him for three years now and I feel my understanding has improved a lot thanks to his thinking process. He is a really nice guy and will give you the piece of advice you need before/after your games anytime

Nikita is an excellent chess coach, he is very well-prepared for each session and has a phenomenal understanding of chess. During the lessons we worked on improving my positional understanding, as well as on how to play more practically. I am looking forward to the next lessons and feel like I am making good progress towards my goal to become International Master. As I am a Fide Master and also a chess coach myself I can say with confidence that Nikita is a good coach even for titled players or ambitious players who want to reach the FM/IM or GM title.

I can definitely recommend him to anyone at any level as he is bound to make you improve, just like he did with me.

I‚Äôm an older player, rated 2000 in USCF. I‚Äôve been playing chess for over 40 years. My dream has always been to get to 2200 and I wanted to take one last shot at it. Hi there. Yevhenii started coaching my two sons (10 and 8) at the end of January 2019. I am writing this review on May 9th, 2019. My sons started to learn chess since May 2018. But before taking Yevhenii's lessons, they've never study chess in any formal way. 
Let me review Yevhenii's coaching from several perspectives. 
First, he is always very responsive and punctual. I put these two points first because I think these are simply necessary virtues for online chess coaches. Can you imagine you can't get in touch with your coach when everything is ready on your side? Trust me, unless some unforeseen things happen, you would never have bad experience like that with Yevhenii. 
Second, my sons enjoy Yevhenii's lessons. He is an IM, but he can communicate with kids at my son's age. My two sons tell me that they can understand pretty much everything Yevhenii teaches them. Yet this does not mean that the lessons are not challenging at times. Yevhenii will push them a bit whenever he sees fit. 
Third, before taking Yevhenii's lessons, none of my sons are in county team (we live in the U.K.). They play for a local primary school team. Their board order is very low. With the lessons going on, my sons are also making progress. Now my younger son is in county team board 4 (out of 12) and school U9 board 1 (out of 6). My old son is selected for county U11 team for training. Hopefullly he will get in the team soon. As you can tell, it is much harder for older kids who started late to catch up. At school, my older son is board 2 in the B team. 
Yes, basically this is what I want to say. Yevhenii is a responsive coach who is good at teaching kids (well, I bet adults, too).

Excellent at analyzing your games with you. Shows you classic or recent games and puzzles, is very reflective, and answers all your questions related to the game. Ignacio (or rather Nacho as I call him) is an excellent teacher. His keen insight into positional chess (something that most master such as Polgar, insist on learning) is phenomenal. He ask his students (like me) to verbally tell him what is my thought process. By doing so, he spots the weakness in my reasoning and logic. In so doing, he is able to correct my thought process, create new pathways in my rationale and thus improve my chess. Is not about learning a bunch of moves or openings (something he recommends doing at a very advance level) but rather, like Polgar herself recommended me when I spoke to her, that I should focus my chess on strategy, positions, and the like. This is what Nacho is doing with me and I feel that my goal of reaching 1,800 ELO is not only achievable, but rather a first step, knowing I can have him as a coach for life. Do yourself a favor, book a lesson with him and you will realize why I have chosen him as my ONLY coach even if I reach 2,000 ELO. If you need more info or to clarify anything, do reach out.....

Over the last three years I have worked with three professional coaches, the most recent of which is Nacho.

  - Nacho has been my favourite coach by a country mile. I have found that he is able to strike a perfect balance between keeping things fun and interesting, yet also remaining productive and goal focussed.
  - Nacho will work with you to find out exactly what you want from chess, set realistic long term and short term goals, and he will tailor his coaching to address your weaknesses and ways you would like you to improve. 
  - If you want it, he'll also keep you accountable, and assign you as much homework/designate a personal study plan for you to work on if you're hungry for it. 
  - For those adult learners like myself who have a busy schedule would like a more relaxed approach to learning, I've found he's been incredibly accommodating, and has made his coaching ideal for my specific needs. 
  - Nacho also has an innate talent for connecting with people, forming a solid friendship, and adapting his teaching style to align with the way you respond best to learning. 
  - He will challenge the way you think about chess and strategy holistically, from the fundamentals, to specific topics like psychology, certain opening lines/prep, or habits on and off the board that are holding you back. 
  - Also for what you're getting his hourly rate is very very competitive. 

Speaking from the experience of an adult learner, I highly recommend Nacho for a coach, I don't think you could find a better one.

I have been a student of Jonas Hacker for about 6 weeks now. He provides homework if the student wants to which includes tactics, endgames and different openings to study at home. A few weeks after I had started working with him I gained 90  DWZ points in a single tournement. He is very good at explaining difficult chess problems  and I am happy that I found him as a teacher.

Diana from the word go has been patient and some would probably say gone far and beyond what I could expect of a coach. Diana is just totally genuine. Her pre-lesson preparation would put a lot of school teachers to shame.  Beyond the stare is a heart of 24 carat gold.  Her chess CV defies her youthfulness. Good teachers want to improve their pupils and themselves Diana's doing both.  I've had four lessons with her only her University and my current book editing has stopped us doing more.

Having experienced excellent lessons with Diana for a couple of months now, I thought it was time I wrote a review. In general, her lessons are not only thoroughly instructive (I've hit personal all time high ratings in both online rapid and classical since starting the lessons) but also very enjoyable (she has a a very affable demeanour which keeps the learning both light and fun). I'll try to be more descriptive under the below headings to reflect the experience she provides you with.

Knowledge: Diana clearly has a wide and impressive knowledge of this complex sport. I was taken aback by her playing experience listed in her coach profile and it is evident in all her lessons (be they focusing on openings, end game, tactics, etc). I think more important is her ability to understand where you are at as a player with your unique strengths and weaknesses. Her in-class probing questions or her after class tasks are always pitched at that sweet spot of being doable but with an effort sufficient to really drive improvement. She is also always very adept at giving gentle almost subliminal hints for particularly challenging questions (only when needed).

Professionalism: Diana's work ethic is also one of the striking features of working with her. During her lessons, you will experience her pour over both sample games and your own games which enhanced your understanding of various principles. Her provision of a wide variety of 'home work'¬† has also vastly enhanced my tactical vision. She is always very giving with her time too. Lessons are never cut off upon the end of the paid hour but let to come to their natural end so that learning is cemented.
I havent been coached by Diana, But i can tell you that she is a great and positive person! im sure she can teach great as well, as her streams are amazing and fun :D

I have been working with Diana for just over a year and have had a wonderful experience. I have had many different teachers in my life, and in many different disciplines.  Without question, Diana is one of the best I have ever had. 

She is very good at analyzing her students' games and tailoring instruction to the student's level and understanding. 

She is honest in her instruction and holds nothing back. Her goal is the progress of her students, and she will give important and critical feedback when necessary. 

She is very articulate in her explanations of concepts. Diana teaches very conceptually, and this is really important for my personal progress. I have always needed to understand why things work the way they do, and because of how Diana teaches, my understanding of chess has deepened significantly. 

My rating has improved by 300 points since I have been working with her. I really can't recommend Diana enough. Wish I could give ten stars.

Diana is a fantastic coach. She'll find and work through relevant positions effortlessly with you when you review your games with her. She'll also slow down and focus on key concepts whenever appropriate. Obviously, she's naturally skilled at the game, but her innate optimism and patience as a teacher is what makes lessons with her joyful as well as a challenge. I recommend her for anyone.

Relly cannot believe Diana has been in my corner for almost two years. Yesterday I hit a previously unthinkable high at puzzles all because of her patience and belief in me. Would I recommend Diana to disabled students or to parents with aspiring kids = Definitely glad to be part of Team Mirza Chess as I call her group of students

I have recommended Zahar to many of my friends and they have enjoyed his lessons as well.

Dan is an excellent chess coach. When I started with him, I was rated 1650. We worked mostly on analyzing my lichess games, where I made numerous positional / strategic mistakes. After a month of coaching, my strategic awareness improved substantially and my rating soon climbed up to 1800. I couldn't have wished for a better coach!

I want to recommend Dan as a chess coach.  

He explains things clearly, using diagrams, key squares and key ideas (specifically for endgame lessons), and follow-up exercises.  The lessons are also reinforced with homework assignments. 

I appreciated that he is a professional: he keeps his appointments, speaks courteously and patiently, and has a definite plan on what and how he's going to teach you. 

I think perhaps his best quality is that he makes you feel comfortable asking questions and trying problems again and again and again until you understand them.

I discovered this wonderful game at the age of 40.  I was afraid that I was too old to learn anything more than simply how the pieces move. 

I floundered about online and with PC and apps thinking I was making some progress on my own, but as soon as I moved beyond "level 1" I quickly realized I was terribly unqualified.

This eventually led me lichess.org, where I found the coaching services of DrHack.  I use the word "coaching" as opposed to "teaching" because now that I have contracted the services of the good Doctor, he is indeed my coach, not simply a teacher.

After 2 lessons, I finally had a break thru moment.  In these 2 lessons, Dan has taught me fundamentals in the endgame and opening.   Things are starting to "click" for me.

After trying to learn this game on my own by watching videos, reading, studying and playing puzzles, I now realize that the real, tangible improvements I have made have come from Dan's coaching.

I will continue my lessons with DrHack and highly recommend him as your coach.

Thanks Doc.

Dan is a very knowledgeable player, and also a great teacher. As of this writing, I have been taking lessons with Dan for about 3 months and have become a much stronger player. I was rated 1230-ish in rapid at the time, and now I am at 1460 and still climbing quickly. I'm very happy with my progress under his guidance, and strongly recommend him.

Dan was very clear with his lessons, and I improved quite a bit with them. He was easy to speak with and helped me prepare for (and review) my OTB tournament games. 

My understanding of the endgame specifically is much greater than before thanks to Dan's tutelage.

Dan was a great teacher, and my chess skills improved a great deal in  a few months of lessons. His willingness to tailor our lessons to my schedule and also my skill level were a real boon. I consistently find myself going back to the studies we worked on as a way to continue to improve!

Five stars! Dan ‚ÄúDr Hack‚Äù Hronchek is a phenomenal instructor! Rather than starting with complicated openings Dan helped me build a solid foundation by focusing lessons on the end game. Some of his lessons included these topics: piece quality, the classics (think the evergreen or opera games), bishop vs. pawn, rook vs. minor, rooks vs. pawns, knights vs. bishops, pawn vs. pawn, pawn weaknesses, pawn structures, knights vs bishops, and much more. Next he helped me create an entire repertoire of openings. I now have an opening response for almost all of white‚Äôs openings and a reply to however black responds to my white openings! Dan has been able to take complex theories such as the Bahr‚Äôs rule and make them understandable for a beginner. If you are a new player or someone that has been playing for a while I suggest Dan as an excellent coach to build a strong chess foundation and guide you through many stages of your chess. For the past nine months of weekly coaching Dan has been timely, professional, and supportive. Thank you, Dan.

Mr. Hronchek is a great coach! He has his own way of explaining endgames concepts and makes them much easier to understand. He will also watch you play quick games at the end of your lessons, where each lesson has a theme (i.e. Space advantage etc.)  and you try to keep that theme in mind for the games. I have to say I have learned a lot and cannot wait to continue learning from him! I highly recommend Dan Hronchek as a coach!!! He is amazing!

Dan has a passion for both teaching and playing chess. He is a true student of what it takes to help others improve their chess.   I  plateaued trying to teach myself and after a few lessons Dan had my rating on Lichess going up.   My black opening repertoire especially was non-existent and with Dan's help , it is probably now the strongest part of my game.  He selects openings and other lessons appropriate to the student and their goals.  Dan is on time, patient, professional, fun, excellent at explaining and being organized.  Highly recommended.

I have nothing but good things to say about Dan and my experiences with him as my chess coach. He has deep knowledge of all aspects of the game and is a very personable guy. He really opened my eyes to the game and helped bridge the gaps in my knowledge. My rating just continues to climb with the knowledge Dan has passed to me.

Dan brings an intelligent and organized plan to his coaching.  It is clear that Dan considers what to work on in advance of our lessons, which makes the time we spend efficient and fast-paced.  He knows that I am an "adult-improver," and I believe he understands the challenges in the learning process for someone of my (middle) age, level of ability, and time available to study.  I have great respect for a teacher or coach--in any field or endeavor--whose goal is the education and betterment of the student, and Dan is a teacher who has that quality.

Dan is an excellent teacher.  I've had a few chess coaches in the past, but most of them weren't good at teaching, or their broken English was exhausting to listen to.  And given his very reasonable hourly rate, I feel like I can work with him for a long time to come.

My long overdue review of Dan "DrHack" coaching .  So in Nov of 2019 I decided to start taking chess seriously, and in Jan of 2020 I started weekly coaching sessions with Dan.  Dan's coaching has helped me achieve great progress from 1000 to having a blast at 1750 in just over half a year.   

Dan has a constant professional attitude , adaptable teaching approach, and makes every coaching session full of value.   

As a struggling self studied you-tuber, Dan has explained to me things in a way that I retain and understand beyond what you tube has ever able to achieve with me.   

Would & Have Recommended Dan to all.
To be frank, Dan is a hell of a coach. He is patient, thorough, and incredibly knowledgeable. He's a pleasure to talk to and I honestly can't recommend him enough.

Dan is extremely knowledgeable and presents material in a very systemic and easy to grasp manner.  Hei is very friendly and and strives to help the student understand and excel in all aspects of the game. I highly recommend him a chess coach.

Long overdue review - I started doing weekly sessions with Dan back around Jan of 2019, mainly because I wanted to be able to beat some friends and family (I had been a pretty causal player since I was a kid but never took it seriously.) Until that point I had a hard time keeping my rating past 1300 in classical. Within a few months of working with Dan, my rating steadily went up to 1500 and above and I started to keep my gains. I also gained a much better and clearer understanding of the game, as well as understanding what I needed to do to improve. And obviously with all that, I was able to beat most of my friends and family pretty consistently too :). Highly recommend Dan as a coach, he is extremely knowledgeable and also just overall a friendly person and fun to work with, if you listen to him and put in the time you will see the results.

Raven started coaching me soon after I played my first tournament. At the time, I had a rating just over 1500, but I had lofty aspirations of becoming a master. Within a year of starting my training, I competed in the U1800 section of the World Open and tied for first. I had significantly improved my understanding of positional and dynamic play and was actively seeking the correct plan in a given position instead of hoping for tactics to arise. Raven's training was rigorous and he devoted significant time to providing me study material and reviewing games. With each position we studied, my ideas were taken seriously and we worked out the variations together. By building the habit of seeking to fully understand every training position, I was able to progress much faster than my peers, and after a mere 80 tournament games since I started training with Raven, I reached a rating of 2141 FIDE. To anyone looking for a dedicated coach with a proven track record, I would wholeheartedly recommend Raven.

As an American Candidate Master, professional chess coach, and meditation trainer, I have devoted my life to understanding why mastering a craft and teaching a craft are so different. So looking for a personal chess coach for myself, I was well aware that rating wasn't everything. I chose Raven to bring me to the next level because I was blown away by his approach. He perfectly understood my developmental trajectory, and diagnosed the mental blockages I needed to overcome. Then he personalized a multi-layered approach fusing basic human psychology with the nuances of chess. Finally, Raven cared enough to track my progress tournament by tournament, reframing my strengths and weaknesses game by game. When I began with Raven I was 1090. Within a year and nine months my rating peaked at 2156. I'm confident he was the perfect coach for me.

During the analysis it is clear that Thibault has a vast knowledge and a quick mind, and he most importantly has the gift to share his insights in a manageable way. It's a very encouraging experience to be coached by him and I look forward to our next lesson!

Over the past year, GM Hungaski has been a great coach for my son. Robert is a brilliant coach which is why it is not surprise that he is a US team coach. His theory is rock solid as my daughter started winning games against much better players. Coach Robert  is a superb coach who can bring out the best in the players he coaches. 

My daughter went to World Cadet last year with no expectations as she was far from the top ranked in her age group. But we did one thing right ! That is, we selected Coach Robert who accompanied the delegation. Before that, we only saw his videos in St Louis Chess Club. Every day we had 30 minutes preparation before the game with him and then we would review after the game. We were totally blown away with his dedication and mastery guidance based on opponent and my daughter's weakness and strength. Using my daughter's own words, Robert brought out the MAGIC in her games. She followed his well laid out plan and uplifted her level to  somewhere never seen before. We highly recommend Coach Robert Hungaski without any reservation.

Robert 's teaching is patient, non-judgmental, deep but fun. I gave him a specific task: get me ready to play again after a long layoff from chess. With his inspiration and guidance I am now studying the game in a manner and with an efficiency I have never experienced before. I can feel my chess strength returning and armed with new sources of knowledge and with new tools I am sure to exceed previous strength and results.

GM Hungaski could answer every question I have, including the really weird ones. He usually gives me different tasks to do, depending on what I have to work on. His teaching includes everything you need to know about the endgame, middlegame, and opening. I always look forward to his lessons because not only is he an amazing coach, he also has a good sense of humor, he could make me laugh all the time, even when I'm learning.

I have been working with Mr. Hungaski for about 3 years now (February 2016). My rating around the time I started working with him was around 1600. We started by working on the aspects of my game that I was having trouble with, such as endings (Bishop and Knight vs. King and Rook and Bishop vs Rook). We also worked a lot on building my positional foundation to the point where I now consider myself a rather positional player. He also focused more on understanding than just trying for quick results, which really helped my game in the long term, as I am able to use the lessons I learned 3 years ago. This approach allowed me to improve from 1660 to 1900 in just one year. I have since seen steady rating increase to 2100. He also helped me prepare for the World Youth Championships in September 2017, where I, as a 1900, beat 5 players higher rated than me. I still use him as my coach today and I am confident I will keep improving for the rest of my chess career. Overall, I have improved a lot under Mr. Hungaski's guidance and would recommend him to any enthusiastic chess player. 

Ankit Raparthi

Working with IM Novak ƒåabarkapa was an amazing experience

have been working with Novak for almost than 1 year and I am very happy with his coaching style, my improvement and the quality Novak offers. He's also friendly and patient as a person. He is very good in teaching plans in different structures, very good opening preparation teaching method.

I‚Äôve been working with Novak last 12 months, once to twice a week. His love to the game and to teaching others, his methodology and orientation to details, made me certainly a better player (Lichess rating +300 points to the current ~2200). But, more importantly, he helped me to come back to the game I played a lot as a child and after 35 years, I am going to play a real chess tournament.
You can expect from Novak to build your opening portfolio, to the level that it will be very hard to surprise you. He will focus on your favorite openings, not his. He will look for solid, but not so common variations, so that you can surprise your opponents! 
He reviews your games, finds common mistakes and focuses on them. 
A typical lesson will include review of my lichess online games. We would review openings, sometimes learn a new variation and the rest of lesson is the middle game or end game strategy. Sometimes we focus on attacking tactics, but mostly on strategy in a given position. We discuss how to defend a position or how to use the minimal advantage that exists in a given position. We review some famous games.
Novak is a passionate teacher and I strongly recommend him.

Of all the coaches I have worked with I think that Novak has the most practical approach to chess, and I accomplished new milestones immediately after working with him- I beat a GM in an OTB game for the first time, I got a new peak rating after 3 years for both my FIDE and National Ratings, and I hit a peak TPR for a 9 round tournament. Novak's knowledge especially of openings is prolific, while at the same time only focusing on the most relevant factors.

Aside from this I will mention that Novak is incredibly generous with his time outside of the lessons as well, he has sent me several opening files that can only be described as top quality, and they have helped me win real games in tournaments.

Lastly, I should add that Novak is also ambitious about improving- in the past I have worked with coaches who seemed more or less content to stay at their level, but Novak still has aspirations of improving (as he should, he's a relatively young IM who is close to the GM title). I have found this to be motivating as well, and it has inspired me to work harder outside of the lessons.

In short, for only 25‚Ç¨/h, I do not think there is a better deal elsewhere.

Cyril‚Äôs coaching truly deserves a 5 star rating. I've been working with Brandon for a little over 2 years now. I found him via his twitch community and have had nothing but good experiences since then. I encourage prospective students to reach out to me, if you want more details.

When I started working with him, I was rated about 1400, and figured I had maybe an outside chance of making it to 2000ELO strength. Now, though I'm not there yet (1800ish), it feels readily attainable.

Brandon has an amazingly talent for making chess, a game which can feel totally inscrutable over the board, feel totally approachable. He teaches you how to confidently break down a position into its component motifs and plans, and then stitch them back together into a complete understanding.

Logistically, Brandon's been a joy to work with. He's quite flexible on meeting times, professional in his schedule, and is willing to work longer on occasion to finish the lesson.

I look forward to seeing how far he can push my chess in future.

Like many others, I came across Brandon's Twitch stream and during one game he narrated beating me and predicted my thought process pretty well. I was looking for someone to elevate my game from street chess to proper tournament-ready chess so I began taking lessons with him. I think that while I'm not playing proper chess yet, Brandon has helped deepen my understanding of the game at a reasonable rate with an extremely flexible schedule. 

It is difficult to navigate chess but as a teacher Brandon tries to impart wisdom by analyzing positions to understand the imbalances inherent to those positions. Not unlike IM Silman's teachings. 

Brandon is a teacher who knows probably close to every trick in the book but is still someone you can have a normal conversation with. If you play chess casually but are looking to take the next step, I can't imagine there's a better teacher to work with than him.
Very friendly,And excellent citizen in lichess.

I just had my first lesson with Brandon and I'm very impressed!  We're starting by reviewing my recent OTB games. It was obvious that he spent a lot of time carefully analyzing my games prior to the lesson. As he says, Brandon can explain simple and difficult concepts in a clear, straightforward manner. I plan on becoming a weekly student going forward! I've had several coaches (including a GM and IM) and based on my initial impression, Brandon is the best.

I've been working with Brandon for about 18 months now.  Prior to starting lessons with him I had been stuck in the low 1600s (Rapid).  He's helped me through opening theory, calculation, tactics, and how to think positionally.  He's always well-prepared, analyzes my games ahead of time, and pinpoints areas that need improvement.  Brandon is able to explain complicated concepts clearly and brings a lot of enthusiasm.  With his help, I recently hit the 2000 mark in Rapid.  I wish I had started working with him earlier on. Tactics books and videos were helpful, but Brandon's knowledge of the game is what really helped me improve.

I've been taking lessons with Brandon for about a year now, and gone from unrated to 1700+ USCF. I'd say the #1 improvement areas for me since I started working with him is calculation + being concrete about positions instead of playing off general opening motifs. He's extremely well-prepared; if I send him my tournament games before a lesson, by the time we start they're always on the tip of his tongue. He's also a great communicator and never has any trouble understanding my thought process or giving constructive feedback on the areas that need improvement. Lastly, the rate that he charges is very reasonable compared to most other coaches. Would highly recommend.
Great teacher! My game and puzzle rating improved just after a few weeks of instruction!

I contacted Luis because I was stuck with my chess at ~1300 for years and was eager to move forward.

Not all Masters of Chess have mastered teaching it. I'm very lucky Luis takes his teaching as serious as he does his Chess! Luis has a uniquely uncanny way of teaching not just the rules and principles of Chess, but enabling the students to internalize what would otherwise be difficult concepts. He solidifies Chess creativity and fundamentals in his students so no matter their skill level walking into a lesson, the student is vastly superior after the lesson. Not only does a student under Luis' tutelage get better at Chess, but more importantly, they enjoy the lesson and discover a deeper love for the game. I can't recommend Luis strongly enough.

I contacted Luis a few months ago to get back into chess training after the long Covid period without OTB tournaments.
I'm just getting started but I can tell that he is very serious in his coaching. Whether it is about tactics, opening preparation, games analysis or specific studies, Luis will fulfill all your needs. 
Between each lesson, he also provides a good amount of homework to make sure that you are always working on your chess, and is always quick to answer you in case you have any question. 
Looking forward to seeing where the next year with Luis takes me!

Luis is extremely good at explaining complex concepts very easily. He also explains principles in a format that makes them very easy to learn and understand the major concepts. He will give you the big picture ideas and then break them down slowly so that they are easier to digest. He has a tactical playstyle but he mixes it with his extremely concrete positional understanding creating a deadly combo. You can ask questions at any point and he will listen to your question and answer it concisely. I‚Äôve felt a huge improvement in my level since I started. I definitely recommend. 10/10.

Luis is absolutely the coach you need to train with for two reasons: quick improvement and access to an elite chess community.

Every Saturday he and two of his GM colleagues host an event - we've done simultaneous exhibitions, lectures, and tournaments with prizes. Not everybody can say they've played against a GM or IM.

Luis also helped me get over a plateau I couldn't overcome myself. I was stuck at 1000 on Chess.com and couldn't figure out where I needed to improve. Luis helped me sharpen my tactical vision by giving me books with themed puzzles. He provided thought processes for avoiding blunders and finding the best move. He also taught me fundamentals of the game that would've taken way too long for me to arrive at by just watching YouTube videos or reading books, such as attacking weak squares in your opponents' positions. I'm not the hardest worker and he was able to take me to 1400 in 6 months.

He is a great teacher who stresses the fundamentals as often as possible, providing many clear examples.  I have been doing lessons for a while now, and I can feel an improvement in the way I am looking at the game.  He is fun to work with, and he is a relaxed person.

I have been playing OTB for almost a year at this point and stagnated for the last few months. (From 1700 to almost 1800)

In terms of experience taking his lessons, have been very insightful. He starts off with looking over your games and is able to point out weak points in your play. From there it is working on fundamentals and better way to think through your games. I do highly recommend him if you are looking for a coach.

He helps to target your weaknesses and doesn‚Äôt bombard you with information that you can‚Äôt handle at your level. I've only had a few lessons so far, but I'm already improving. In our lessons, we solve puzzles using logic and strategy. Then, we play a game and evaluate the moves. We also work on my weaknesses, like endgames.

I have studied under the tutelage of Zach for approximately 6 months now and I cannot emphasize how beneficial his lessons have been to my growth as a student in this wonderful game of chess.  Zach is incredibly prepared for his lessons, tailoring them specifically to the weaknesses and strengths of the students. He has allowed me to see detriments in my play and grow from the mistakes I have made in-game. His teaching education is very much felt in his teaching style and the structure of his lessons. You can expect to learn common themes of chess, for example, knight vs bishop, colour complexes, trading pieces, pawn play, etc, and games played by masters emphasizing the themes that were learned to further engrain them into your mind. Zach is a light-hearted guy that can joke with you, but he will keep you honest through weekly goals with respect to tactics, games, readings, etc.  His training regiment and lessons have allowed my chess game to flourish, facilitating my climb from 1100 to a peak of 1600 on chess.com which in January was my goal for the end of 2021. I cannot emphasize how outstanding Zach is as a teacher and if you are passionate about the game of chess and are eager to learn, you will not regret the decision to take lessons with Zach.

I cannot speak highly enough about Zach's excellent ability to engage with a student's strengths and weaknesses and identify a detailed lesson plan to help them improve. His approach is balanced between theoretical chess and practical chess. He not only has a deep understanding of theory, but he knows exactly how to teach those theories in accessible and applicable ways. 

When I first started my weekly, 2-hour sessions with Zach, I was stuck at about a 1350-1400 (Elo on chess.com). I wasn't able to stabilize my rating, let alone improve it. After one month of sessions with Zach, my rating is now almost 1600, and I feel I have a much better understanding of middlegame dynamics and decision making. All thanks to Zach. 

Zach not only identified my strengths and weaknesses but gave me specific, detailed lesson plans and homework to work on between our sessions. It is clear that Zach, as a trained teacher, is a professional that knows how to apply his pedagogical approach to coaching chess. 

On top of all of his knowledge and interactive sessions, Zach is very funny. His wit and humour keep sessions light hearted while also expressing clear expectations and discipline to make sure you are serious about improving. 

In short, Zach is a gifted teacher, and we are lucky to have his coaching skills in the chess community.

Krisztian is a fantastic coach. Let me explain why! While you can learn an opening from a book, doing so is only a fraction as valuable as understanding the transition from opening theory to a middle game plan. If you understand those transitions, it makes chess much easier, as you play from good positions with good plans, rather than trying to reinvent the wheel. In only a few months my rating has gone up more than 10% (on chess.com, profile ‚Äúpageon‚Äù, now 2100-2200 in blitz and 2200-2300 rapid). I now get outplayed from the opening much more rarely. It is all thanks to Krisztian‚Äôs zoom coaching sessions with me. I highly recommend him as a coach. He is also a very nice person.

I really enjoy our lessons krisztian, during this month i learned a lot about chess and we managed to create a really strong opening repertoire that i like a lot. I appreciate that even though i‚Äôm not great you don‚Äôt rush and made sure that I understand everything before explaining something else. Looking forward to many more training sessions with you.

As an adult chess improver, I can highly recommend Viktoria as a coach. Our sessions are helpful, thoughtful, and fun.  Lessons run the gamut from analyzing weekly tournament games to tactics, openings, and endgame play and my chess has improved greatly under Viktoria's tutelage.

I‚Äòm a late-comer to chess, and reached out to Viktoria intending to take two or three lessons to lay a solid foundation I could build from on my own. A year later, I‚Äôm still meeting with her weekly. We analyze my games, review tactical and strategic concepts, and make a self-study plan for the week that covers all phases of the game. Though we have a lot of fun in our sessions, she clearly takes her job very seriously, following my games through the week and checking in with me outside our scheduled times. Her investment in my development as a player has inspired me to push past the goals I initially set for myself to see how good I can get. I can‚Äôt recommend her highly enough.

She is both kind and patient, but she also pushes me to advance my game. She gives me homework to help improve my game (e.g., end-game puzzles and instruction to play more real (living) opponents and not just the computer). During some lessons we perform a post mortem on one of the game I played during the previous week. During others we would ‚Äúplay‚Äù a game against each other where we would discuss various lines of play and my thinking process (and how to improve my thinking process). Both types of lessons are extremely helpful. Viktoria is great. I cannot recommend her highly enough.

I recommend Aleksandra as a coach to anyone who is looking for a structured training program. I have been working with Aleksandra for about 4 months. Her lessons are very well structured and I have benefited from them tremendously. I decided to look for private coaching because I had hit a plateau in the way I was playing, and was aimlessly jumping from one dvd course to another without seeing much benefit. Aside for each lesson being well structured, there is a good flow from one week to another, we started with basic end game principles and have been working toward more advanced positions. Each lesson structure consists of us going over homework which is a set of about 15-20 problems on a tactical theme, the we analyze a particular type of positions or games for a given theme, and conclude with a few tactical problems that are related to the next homework theme. Unlike passively watching videos, when I do something wrong in the lesson I no longer have my wrong inner confidence tell me that I am still correct and can move on, I think this has helped me solidify some understanding better. Overall I would say having a better understanding of the themes we have covered have allowed me to construct better plans in positions where I would previously go into blind liquidation. As far as my rating improvement goes, it has become less volatility, on chess.com, I used to fluctuate between 1400-1600, I am now consistently staying in the 1600s breaking into 1700.

I have been taking weekly chess lessons with GM Vetoshko for 4 months now (over 30h and not stopping soon!) and my satisfaction with this coach is beyond what words could possibly express.
Volodymyr is the perfect combination of an extremely skilled and passionate player and a fantastic teacher. He starts by identifying your strengths, weaknesses and current level, and then sets the cursor of his lessons slightly above your level. That way the lessons are challenging but optimal in terms of progression. He also gives you tools (such as opening strategies) that match your preferred playing style. Volodymyr's mastery of the game makes him instantly understand and anticipate your questions and patterns of thoughts in an impressive, enjoyable, and useful way, and his didactic skills (which I think are hardly matchable) make him convey information in a very clear and concise manner.  Further, he makes his classes diverse by providing a mix between tactics, strategy, games analysis, theory and practice. That generates a very interesting and fun experience, while also providing good moments of laughs with that very sympathetic coach. Volodymyr is also flexible and extremely committed, adapting his teaching to your objectives and time availability, and takes the time to give you (and correct) additional exercises between lessons if you want to progress faster. He speaks perfect English, and the price/quality ratio of that coach is in my opinion simply unmatchable.

I am a 'return to chess' retired senior player.  I  'met' Can as a chess coach during the first C19 lockdowns, seemed a good thing to do rather than endless Netflix.  My goals were clear, not to be coached back to  FIDE 1800 +, or whatever I was 40 years ago, but to bring some joy back to playing chess, win or lose.  After our first few sessions I knew that Can was the right choice because of his open, honest and extremely knowledgeable approach to my games.  There was no pressure from Can to move away from my beloved openings,  no "why not consider the KID or Scotch gambit, it might suit you better", rather, Ok, lets look at your typical  middle game positions and lets see if we can improve on your approach from there on.  This would be backed up with analysis of similar games from the masters and identification of weaknessess in my middle game play....such as my over the board inability to recognise when it was time to sit on my hands and do some serious work.....  make no mistake, Can will not let you get away with sloppy calculation or postion assessment.  Combined with his deep passion for teaching and  improving your own play,  it makes you want to give back as good as you get, and when you do and Can sees the improvements he has helped to foster, it clearly brings him joy too.

Can is not only an exceptional chess player and coach, but he has PhD in the field of cognitive science. As a 1700 Elo player, I faced opponents with ratings ranging from +200 to +400 during my league games. Adriana is an incredibly talented chess player and an excellent training partner. We dedicated ourselves to intensive training sessions every day for ten days leading up to the match. Tijana is an excellent and very dedicated chesscoach. She gives the lessons in a very clear and enthousiastic way. The lessons are personal lessons , she takes a lot of preparations  and thorough preparations and analyzes your chessgames before she starts her lesson. This way Tijana knows exactly  your level of chess and which part of your game needs improvement.  Every lesson has a specific topic and is fully focussed on your personal skills. This way your skills of playing chess are improving very rapidly. She is open minded and always with a very positive attitude which is very important too . That way it is a joy to have lessons from Tijana and  to learn chess better and to improve your chessgame. After the lesson she sends you all the material of the given lesson, so you can look back at the material. If you want to improve your personal chess skills and  want to improve fast, she is absolutely the best chess coach you can get. No doubt about that !

Tijana is encouraging and positive in how she approaches each lesson. You can tell that she wants me to do well. And that she has a great love of the game of chess. These qualities come through in every lesson. That is why I have taken many lessons from her.
 
For my first lesson, I told Tijana that I wanted help with how to attack. She prepared a detailed lesson. We went through various ways of attacking a castled king by focusing on the various focal points in the enemy's castled position. She gave me a pgn file with all the examples we had used during the lesson and many more examples. She also provided the same examples in Chessbase format when I asked for it.

For the second lesson, we reviewed some games I had recently played under slow time controls on chess.com and lichess.org. Tijana analyzed the games on her own time to prepare for the lesson. As we went through the games, Tijana would point out the various mistakes that my opponent and I had made during the game. She also suggested alternative strategies that I could have used during the game to give me more ideas on how to play next time. I discussed my various thoughts I had during the games and she provided feedback on how to think about the position. Tijana also points out the critical times during the game when a decisive move was either made or missed.
 
Tijana answered all my questions in great detail during the lesson. You can tell that she knows her stuff. I liked this lesson so much that I have reviewed many more games with her in the following lessons. We have also used the time to discuss good and bad pieces and how to handle various openings and middlegame plans that my opponents throw at me. She always provides a pgn file of my games with her analysis and comments added in so I can review them later.

In short: a great coach at a great price!

With great respect, I bow deeply to my Master Tijana Blagojevic. A true warrior with chess pumping through her veins. Her mother is a Master, her father is a Grandmaster and Master Tijana is the heir apparent to her family's throne. Within the first week of her teachings, she lifted my chess rating by 100 points and we are just getting started. She is my secret weapon, I employ her to sharpen my mind and open my eyes to any blind spots I may have. It is a great honor to call her Master and I will be her student until I can stand next to her in battle with the Blagojevic flag behind me pouncing on my opponents. So if you love chess and have a desire to get better, learn from a documented champion and join us in battle. But if you decline be prepared to have nightmares of us rushing your castle and knocking down every piece along the way until we have your King in a checkmated square. For Honor, for Victory, for another 10 thousand years of battle on these light and dark squares.

WIM mlatb's repertoire philosophy¬†for a student at my level is to balance time with the problems you can set for your opponent.¬† It's an active repertoire¬†that isn't afraid of lines like From's gambit against 1.f4 and accepting the Morra gambit.¬† Playing the c3/Alapin against the Sicilian is great at my level as it allows a small edge and more importantly frees up time to learn other skills.¬† It's great to be playing 1.e4 again.

Also he was able to assign meaningful homeworks and point us to the right direction regarding the question we might have or weaknesses he spots in our games or thought process. Highly recommend!

Amir has been wonderful. He is always on time and ready and has been flexible and accomodating for my schedule. We spend a lot of time looking at games I've played and learning about different plans and ideas has been super helpful to me. I really appreciate Amir's help and highly recommend him to anyone looking to take their game to the next level.

Frankly, Amir is an amazing coach. I've had him as a coach for ~3 months now. In that time, I set ambitious goals to cover endgames in more detail, and a new set of openings to learn at my ~1800 OTB, ~2000 online level. Amir helped me to accomplish this and more. He was very prepared each session, whether it was pre made studies, examples of my own games, etc. He was very responsive to quick shifts in agendas and outcomes. I've seen solid improvement in all of my outcomes since then. If you're reading this and wondering why Amir has so many glowing reviews, it is because he is that special of a coach.

Amir is a truly excellent coach!  He ensures each lesson is personalized to the needs of the student and is patient and thoughtful in his explanations.   As an adult improver, Amir has done much to improve my understanding of chess foundations.  He is able to easily suit his lessons for a wide range of experience levels from beginner to master.

Top-tier coach! After studying with Amir for about 8 months, I've been really impressed with his high-quality studies, insightful analysis of my games, and practical advice on tournaments and openings. He breaks down and explains positions very well, and I always take something from our lessons. I think what's even more impressive, though, is how professional and generous he is with his time. Never late, always prepared, and there have been many occasions when we run over the time but we continue until the lesson is finished. That's commitment! If you are serious about improving, then you can't go wrong with Amir. Highly recommended!

Ankit is a fantastic coach that truly cares about the progress of his students. He is always quick to answer questions either about homework or other chess questions in general. He is one of the few coaches I worked with that actually tries to improve your thinking techniques and quality of thought rather than just give you a lecture on a specific topic. Of course, during the lesson, he will give useful tips and knowledge about typical positions or methods but the valuable things I took away from the lessons is definitely different approaches to thinking in different positions - things i have not seen mentioned in books. My time with GM Rajpara was very eye opening. I had to stop the lessons due to time commitments with family but when I return to chess in the future I definitely will not hesitate to hire Ankit as a coach again if he is available!

I have been training with Ankit for a few years. He shows so much care regarding the needs of a student. He is responsible and tries to understand the thought process and then train accordingly. He have lot of patience, I think he is one of the finest coaches in all aspects.

I have been coached by GM Ankit for the past 6months and across 1 tournament.  I am honoured to write the following testimonial for him.

GM Ankit is both  knowledgeable and  approachable. He is very experienced, having played the game for many years himself . He has improved my understanding of the game by looking thru my games, identifying areas of weaknesses and structuring the lessons appropriately. Finally, he has also taught me how to organise my learning in a more structured manner, something which has benefitted me greatly.

There‚Äôs a misconception that to improve in chess all you need are good databases and a chess engine. That is simply not true. I‚Äôm glad that there are good coaches like GM Ankit around to help us non professional amateurs get better along in our chess journey thru solid teachings and training. I look forward to working alongside with him in 2020 and beyond.

Ankit is a great coach that takes coaching his students personally. During the lessons he dives deep into fixing the student's weaknesses that are found by him on his own time before the lesson from the games that the student sends him. This has drastically improved my positional understanding of the game. Whenever I have any questions and I message him, I know that I will not have to wait long at all because Ankit replies very quickly, which I think shows the dedication that he has towards the progress of his students. Also, he has never been late to any one of my lessons. This was a major problem for me with my former coaches, but I am very pleased with his consistency. Overall, if you want to improve your positional understanding of the game,  I can guarantee that Ankit has the means to do so.

I have had almost 10 lessons with Ankit, and they have all been fantastic. 

Ankit deeply prepares for his lessons rather than just turning up and rushing through some of your games. The lessons are structured around a particular theme, and build on previous lessons' topics. I am always impressed how Ankit makes links between different lessons; it makes it really feel like I am building a good base of knowledge. It also makes it clear that he cares about the lessons and the student's progress.

Some weeks Ankit will go through some of my recent games. But he will have prepared these before the lesson, and will focus on a few key moments from each game. Again, the preparation from Ankit is superb - other coaches may not prepare so much and therefore a lot of the lesson time would be wasted.

In addition to the lessons, Ankit provides lots of guidance and material on how to train. He highlighted early on some of my strengths & weaknesses, and then developed a training program to work on these. So, not only do I get the lessons themselves, but also lots of material to work on outside of the lesson.

Ankit is very generous with his time and will respond to questions outside of lesson time.

I am so pleased I have started taking lessons from Ankit. I highly recommend you do the same, too. 5 stars just isn't enough to express how fantastic he is.

Ankit is a very Good coach, he is very patient and cares about your progress as a player. He helped me improve my thinking method and showed me where I need to focus on more to improve. He plans his lesson based on the areas he believes you need to improve and that is to be admired. I would highly recommend him to be your coach.

My best coach in all my chess career. He is very patient with you, but also vigilant in answering your questions outside of the class. He puts on a poker face and will not reveal any hints about the positions that he gives to the students. It is evident that he spends a lot of time before the class looking at your games and preparing the class material. All of Ankit's classes have been fun, and with each one I learn a lot. All in all he is a great coach that I highly recommend.
very good teacher
Coach Coco has everything you‚Äôd want in a teacher; he‚Äôs organized, knowledgeable, experienced and maybe most importantly he‚Äôs very a good listener and will meet you at your level.
Great coach, is very good at teaching, especially his way of teaching openings

Not only does he make good use of your time together, but he also gives specific guidance to help you improve your independent studies/play. Can't speak highly enough!

I have been training under Evgeny for almost a year, and what a year it has been! I am 44 years old and an extremely busy full time real estate professional. I knew the basic concepts of chess when I started, however I had only once played an over the board game in 1995 while in college. I got on chess.com and proceeded to get my butt kicked by EVERYONE, which led to major frustration. After a few weeks of beat downs, I hired Zhenya to help me understand this ancient game. After a lesson a week for almost a year, I am currently 1660 on lichess, playing rapid. 

Zhenya has helped transform my game at each lesson. As I progress, he increases the training just enough to understand and improve step by step. He has helped me to understand patience within the game, which has also led me to have more success as a business man. I cannot say enough good things about Zhenya's guidance and wisdom, and I hope to one day reach 2000 level, although I know it will not be without a ton of hard work and studying. 

If you are serious about improving your game, then you must commit to learning long term with Zhenya, and you must be patient because guess what,  chess is hard. I highly recommend Zhenya as your coach only if you are willing to do the work he gives you. 

Commit to him and you will succeed!

Evgeny is a very knowledgeable chess mentor. It is very helpful working with him to understand how he sees the game differently than I do.  He takes the time to explain complicated concepts to me even though they seem trivial to him. But most of all, I really enjoy thinking through some chess positions with him to help guide me. Look forward to it each week.

Evgeny is a great chess teacher. I had dabbled in chess for a while, just playing, not studying or analyzing. Evgeny took one look at my games and laid out a plan for me to not only improve my skill, but also my ability to analyze games and identify my own mistakes. In other words, he showed me how to study chess in addition to how to play better. Since taking lessons with Evgeny I find that I now approach positions with a plan, and I find myself analyzing my games and mistakes without having to force myself, since it is now something I have started to do naturally. Highly recommended!

Evgeny is great! In our lessons, we went through many elements of chess, including openings, positional themes, and methods of attack - and he was tons of help in all of these areas. He explains the ideas and gets results - I gained about 100 ELO points after 5 lessons.

He has the patience of a saint and makes lessons fun while still managing to get great results.  Whether you are a beginner or a veteran, young or old, you will be very happy with the results you get from his lessons.

And at the end he analysed one game for us, i learned a lots of things and it was really entertaining, five stars for sure!

I was a participant in a group lesson that Astaneh had conducted earlier this week (9-29-16).  It was a very interesting and helpful session and his method of including every participant stood out to me. It was less like an instructor lecturing to students and more like a friend sharing his ideas and knowledge of the game. He shared some common mating nets and had us solve more complex problems using those mates that he had showed. His understanding of chess definitely rubbed off on me during the lesson as it commonly does while I watch his live streams; very fun and instructive lesson from my favorite chess player!

I participated in one of Astaneh's group lessons (eight students in total). Astaneh showed us positions in a certain structure for which we then had to solve specific tasks he gave us. For example he showed us a tactical pattern/idea in a theoretical position, then this tactical idea in a more practical position where it is harder to see and then Alex showed us the tactical motif in an actual high level game where none of us students would have seen the tactic if it was not for us seeing the previous positions.

In the end we got homework in the form of a Lichess study with 12 positions to deepen and extend our understanding of the patterns Astaneh showed us in the lesson. A nice benefit of group lessons is that you can learn and improve outside of the lessons by discussing positions with other students on your level of play.

Before coaching starts, Alex will ask you to fill out a questionnaire so that he knows how to best meet the needs of the student.   This approach allows him to provide the instruction that is needed to turn you into the player you want to be.  Great coach, great person. If you want to take the next step in your chess game - Alex is the man to contact.

I focused quite bit on the Grunfeld and Tiamanov recently with Alex. I have yet to lose a tournament game with black. In closing Alex is the very best at helping you find your inner beast mode.

So far we have worked on openings, game analysis, calculation skills, decision making, psychology and many other aspects of my chess.

I have been training with Matvey for about 1 year. In that time, my ratings in rapid and classical have increased by about 300 points. 

Matvey has helped me learn several core openings (e4 with white and responses to e4, d4, and c4 as black). Knowing these openings has helped me identify middlegame plans quicker and has given me more confidence and speed in my play.

We also have a system where Matvey helps me prepare for my opponents in the lichess4545 league. In this context we usually try new openings tailored to my opponent and after each game we deeply analyze the whole game. This exposes me to a larger variety of positions and helps broaden my chess knowledge. 

Matvey also gives me challenging homework which is not just puzzles. They are middle-game and endgame positions, which require calculating many lines. Often a problem is in the format: does move x work? And I have to either show the lines that work or show why it doesn't work. This is more realistic than tactics puzzles, and often there is a core concept at the heart of every homework position that I learn as a result. 

I find lessons with Matvey enjoyable and would definitely recommend him to any student.

I took several lessons from Matvey. He is extremely knowledgable, and he is able to convey his knowledge effectively even to a relative beginner like myself. With his help I learned two new openings as black to reply to d4 (the old benoni) and e4 (the hyperaccelerated dragon). He was able to quickly get me up to speed playing these openings. He is very clear and helpful and able to provide materials for students to try on their own in between lessons to accelerate improvement. I highly recommend him as your chess coach!

For the past 3 months, I took weekly chess lessons from GM Rogic. Mr.Rogic is a friendly instructive coach. He carefully helps me to analyze my opening repertoire and variation choices by using his expertise and latest database suggestions. He is capable to quickly discover my playing strength and weak aspects of my play based on my OTB and online games. In addition, based on my training goal, Mr.Rogic send me lots of study materials alike books and database organized by himself.

Mr.Rogic not only provide instructive chess lessons for me, but also share many interesting chess stories and experiences he went through. Background: I'm about 50 years old, with a full-time job and am definitely not blessed with natural chess skill. I reached out to GM Rogic for lessons after about 6 months of playing online and trying to improve (yes, I am another person who watched "The Queen's Gambit") and have been working with him for over a year. At the time I was (am?) very much a novice player.

Davor focuses on chess strategy, not short-term tactics and that has been extremely educational. The first thing I learned that I wasn't really losing games because "my opponent found a tactic". Instead, I was not developing my pieces, positioning them poorly, wasting time with useless moves, making bad trades, or choosing bad attacking plans . These poor strategic choices would leading to positions where falling victim to a tactic was basically inevitable. On the other hand, I found that if I managed to develop my pieces,  position them well, make purposeful moves, and choose reasonable attacking plans I started winning a lot more games and the tactics would be in my favor. Davor's approach of emphasizing "simple chess", not complex ideas and deep calculation makes the game accessible and learnable. I'm not going to threaten any master-level players with these concepts, but they are extremely effective at my level of play. I would compare Davor's teaching style in this area to the way Daniel Naroditsky explains chess in his youtube videos.

Davor also revamped my opening repertoire, replacing complex openings that I was bad at with simpler approaches. He patiently explained the strategic concepts behind the new openings and my win rate went up.

Result: My online ratings all went up 100-200 points in the first year of training and people. At Davor's suggestion I started playing OTB chess and now have a USCF rating of 1360.
